String.Source: What manner of spell is this? I am curious.
String.Dest: 我很好奇这究竟是一种怎样的魔法？

String.Source: A great calm has swept over me.
String.Dest: 一个卓越的平静术扫过了我。

String.Source: My claws feel sharper, as does my mind.
String.Dest: 我的爪子更锋利了,同样的我的头脑也无比的清晰。

String.Source: Oh! I am invisible! This is not permanent, I hope.
String.Dest: 噢！我隐身了！希望这不是永久的。

String.Source: A healing spell! If body language speaks eloquently, I hope my vigor expresses the proper amount of thanks.
String.Dest: 治愈法术! 如果肢体语言比划得富有表现力的话，希望这气势能表达出足够的感谢。

String.Source: Ah, that feels good.
String.Dest: 啊，那感觉真不错。

String.Source: Interesting that these vampires worship the same master as the dog, yet the two are hostile toward each other. Chaos rules the walls of this shrine.
String.Dest: 有趣的是这些吸血鬼跟那些狗崇拜的对象都是一样的，而这两方居然相互敌对。混沌统治着这祭坛的墙壁。

String.Source: The source of the mist lies ahead. Do you sense it? It is death rising from the ash.
String.Dest: 迷雾的源头就在前面。你感觉到了吗？那是灰烬中升起的死亡。

String.Source: The enchantments on these spiders are but a jester's trick. Their true power still lies in the poison that drips from their fangs.
String.Dest: 在这些蜘蛛上的魔法只是供人嘲笑的把戏。 它们真正的力量仍然在它们的尖齿滴下的毒汁之中。

String.Source: A spider den. We must be cautious, for the hasty fly will soon discover it can no longer flap its wings.
String.Dest: 一个蜘蛛巢穴。我们必须谨慎点，不然只会像仓促的飞行一样，不久之后就会发现再也无力挥动翅膀

String.Source: The first was a test of speed. Is this the same, or does it require cunning? The Greybeards would not have sent you here without the answer.
String.Dest: 首先是速度的测试。这是跟之前一样，还是说需要耍点小聪明呢？如果没有答案的话，灰胡子就不会送你来这儿了。

String.Source: There she is. A bird of Hircine. And she is alone. It seems this flock does not fly as one. This is to our advantage.
String.Dest: 她在那。一只海尔辛之鸟。并且只有她一个，看起来她们没有结伴而行。这对我们很有利。

String.Source: If the sentries outside were any indication, there is something in this cave they wish to conceal. It could be a treasure, or it could be a crime.
String.Dest: 如果警卫外面有任何的迹象,那么他们希望隐藏洞穴里某样东西。 这可能是一件财宝,或也有可能是一名罪犯。

String.Source: (Shivers) This grotto is as cold as the Jerall Mountains it lays beside. It feels as if I am wearing a coat of icicles.
String.Dest: （颤抖着）这个洞穴冷地好像杰哈尔山脉就在旁边一样。感觉我好像穿了一件冰织成的大衣。

String.Source: So the Elf flees impatiently, taking the Golden Claw with him. At times like this, I like to meditate, and let the solution present itself.
String.Dest: 于是那只精灵带着那黄金龙爪急急忙忙地逃跑了。在这种时候，我更希望去谋划，然后让解决方法自然而然地浮现出来。

String.Source: A thrall. That one is a lesser vampire, but we should be careful that we do not stir the rest of the coven when we mount our attack.
String.Dest: 一个奴隶。看来那是只低级吸血鬼，不过我们还是要小心进攻的时候别打搅到其余的大聚会。

String.Source: Necromancers. We must be swift, and kill them before they raise their pets from their slumber.
String.Dest: 亡灵法师。我们必须速战速决，在他们唤醒沉睡的宠物之前干掉他们。

String.Source: Foes block our path. Balance can only be restored when one side perishes.
String.Dest: 敌人挡住了我们的路。只有在其中一方死去的时候，平衡才能得以恢复。

String.Source: This is a spectacular sight. Knowing the ordeals we have endured, Meridia grants us a reprieve, and blesses us with this view of her domain.
String.Dest: 这个景象真壮观，梅瑞迪亚知晓我们一路所受的磨难，便给我们稍事缓解，同时用她领土中的美景祝福我们。

String.Source: Dwarven machinations are a wonder to behold, but they are dangerous as well. We should not be caught looking.
String.Dest: 矮人的阴谋是一个奇迹,但同时，它们很危险。我们不应该陷进去。

String.Source: Simply magnificent! A fitting mausoleum for the founder of the Greybeards. Only a handful of mortals will ever witness what we are now seeing.
String.Dest: 简洁而不失华丽! 一个灰胡子追随者应得的陵墓. 只有极少数凡人得以见证我们今天看到的一切。

String.Source: So this is Nightingale Hall. It is...understated, yet a powerful visual nonetheless. A perfect hideout for the servants of Nocturnal.
String.Dest: 那么，这就是夜莺大厅了。它……低调而不失华丽。诺克图娜尔仆人的完美藏身处。

String.Source: The guards are many. Stay calm, and wait for the opportunity to open.
String.Dest: 守卫很多，冷静下来，等待机会。

String.Source: Never in all my years at the temple did I think I would witness such a mechanical wonder. Even dormant, its effects are palpable.
String.Dest: 我在庙里那么多年都没看到过这么神奇的机械. 做梦都没有, 效果显着.

String.Source: More vampires. Sun and stars hidden from sight, the moonflower blooms in this cavern of night. But not for much longer.
String.Dest: 吸血鬼更多了。太阳和星星不见踪影，月光花在夜晚的洞穴中盛开，但这种现状不会存在太久了。

String.Source: One of the keepers lays in that coffin. But beware. The light shines on the stage, but danger lurks in the audience.
String.Dest: 其中一个守卫躺在那个棺材里。小心，舞台上灯光闪烁，舞台下危机暗伏。

String.Source: Brittleshin Pass. Much like Azura's shrine, some of the world's most decorative sights are built to welcome travelers.
String.Dest: 布莱特辛山隘。有点像阿祖拉神坛, 这个世界上最美妙的景观就为那些旅行者们敞开大门。

String.Source: Lamia, vampires, and succubi. All use beauty to seduce their prey, but only the Spriggan uses the beauty of nature. This grove is one such trap.
String.Dest: 妖妇，吸血鬼，还有女妖 。它们都通过美貌来引诱它们的猎物。但只有树精用自然之美诱惑众生。 这片树林就是这样的一个陷阱。

String.Source: The Dwemer Museum! I have heard that this collection is second only to that excavated from the ruins in Stros M'Kai.
String.Dest: 锻莫博物馆！我听说这里的藏品的丰富程度仅次于图尔斯·迈凯那儿的遗迹所出土的文物。

String.Source: A dragon wall! To find such splendor in this cave, is to find a diamond lodged in a muddy road. I am glad to have walked it.
String.Dest: 一堵龙墙! 在这洞穴中找如此辉煌的东西，简直就像在泥泞小路上找钻石。 我很乐意走一趟。

String.Source: Such a sight! Qa'Dojo is pleased to have witnessed this wonder.
String.Dest: 好漂亮！奎兜啾很高兴见证这一奇迹。

String.Source: The Dwemer built great cities that almost stand the test of time. Yet no structure can or should stand forever. Time willing.
String.Dest: 锻莫修建的伟大城市几乎经得起时间的考验。但没有建筑能够永远屹立不倒。时间会证明一切。

String.Source: A cave. Let us enter. We should not fear the darkness, as it is as much a part of life as the light.
String.Dest: 一个洞穴。我们进去吧。黑暗不会让我们恐惧, 因为它和光明都是我们生命中的一部分。

String.Source: The Nords seek to defy the final arbiter, but if time will not take their souls, he will claim their flesh, and chaos will take their minds.
String.Dest: 那些诺德人搜寻并反抗最后的仲裁者。但即使时间没有磨灭他们的灵魂，也会索取他们的肉体，使他们的精神产生混乱。

String.Source: Hello.
String.Dest: 哈啰。

String.Source: Hello.
String.Dest: 你好。

String.Source: I wish to thank you. Wisdom is always the best gift, but today this will have to suffice.
String.Dest: 我要谢谢你，智慧永远是最好的赠礼，但是今天的话这个就很足够了。

String.Source: Your words are kind. Although I would've liked to hear a parable.
String.Dest: 你的话很贴切，尽管我不喜欢听寓言。

String.Source: (Laughs) I did not realize you enjoyed my parables. In fact, I thought you may have grown tired of them.
String.Dest: (笑声) 没想到你竟然对我的寓言感兴趣。事实上，我原本以为你会慢慢对它们感到厌倦呢。

String.Source: Your words are kind. Although I would've liked to hear a parable.
String.Dest: 你的话很贴切，尽管我不喜欢听寓言。

String.Source: However, if you wish to hear another, it may be wise for you to become the fisherman, rather than request another fish.
String.Dest: 可是，如果你愿听别的。 最明智的做法是你学会自己干，而不是问人拿。

String.Source: Your words are kind. Although I would've liked to hear a parable.
String.Dest: 你的话很贴切，尽管我不喜欢听寓言。

String.Source: If you were to train as a monk, perhaps in twenty or thirty years, you too will learn to recall a story whenever you seek philosophical guidance.
String.Dest: 如果你想被训练成一名修道士，在二三十年之后，你也许同样会在每次寻求哲学的指引之时回忆起一个故事。

String.Source: Your words are kind. Although I would've liked to hear a parable.
String.Dest: 你的话很贴切，尽管我不喜欢听寓言。

String.Source: Until then, I will be more than happy to feed you the occasional parable, should the inspiration strike.
String.Dest: 如果到时候我有灵感的话，我会很乐意用当时想到的喻意指导你。

String.Source: The Aedra and Daedra are not Gods. They are extremely powerful mortals.
String.Dest: 圣灵和魔族不是神，但她们都拥有比凡人们强大的力量。

String.Source: Much like Talos, many believe divinity can be acquired through achievement. It reminds me of the tale of the acclaimed assassin from Black Marsh.
String.Dest: 很多人相信获得足够多的成就能让他们获得神格，就像塔洛斯一样。这使我想起了那个从黑沼泽省来的声名远扬的刺客的故事。

String.Source: The Aedra and Daedra are not Gods. They are extremely powerful mortals.
String.Dest: 圣灵和魔族不是神，但她们都拥有比凡人们强大的力量。

String.Source: The Guildmaster in Riften requested the assassin train his thieves in matters of stealth. However, the assassin refused.
String.Dest: 裂谷城的公会首领要求这名刺客教他的盗贼手下一些潜行的技巧。然而这名刺客拒绝了。

String.Source: The Aedra and Daedra are not Gods. They are extremely powerful mortals.
String.Dest: 圣灵和魔族不是神，但她们都拥有比凡人们强大的力量。

String.Source: For while in the swamps of Black Marsh he was a master, in the forests of Riften he was but a novice.
String.Dest: 当在黑沼泽的湿地中时他是大师，而在裂谷城的森林里他却只是一个菜鸟。

String.Source: The Aedra and Daedra are not Gods. They are extremely powerful mortals.
String.Dest: 圣灵和魔族不是神，但她们都拥有比凡人们强大的力量。

String.Source: A great mortal is a master of their own plane, where a God is a limited by none.
String.Dest: 一名了不起的凡人只有在他自己领域的时候才是大师，而神却是全知全能的。

String.Source: Hm. That is unfortunate, for even the most shallow of relationships are teaching experiences, and the loss of another should be mourned.
String.Dest: 哼嗯，真是不幸，即使只有最浅显的师生之谊也是如此。而且我们应该为我们失去的另外那人而默哀。

String.Source: Are you joking? I barely knew Savrot Iron and Miriam Irvine.
String.Dest: 你是在开玩笑吗？我几乎都没听说过Savrot Iron 和Miriam Irvine。

String.Source: And Namira willing, even death itself has much to teach us. I am reminded of a parable, if you wish to hear it.
String.Dest: 即使死亡本身使我们懂得了很多，娜米拉依旧渴望着。 我想起一个寓言,不知你是否愿意听。

String.Source: Are you joking? I barely knew Savrot Iron and Miriam Irvine.
String.Dest: 你是在开玩笑吗？我几乎都没听说过Savrot Iron 和Miriam Irvine。

String.Source: I am on nobody's side but my own. You'd do well to remember that.
String.Dest: 我只服务与自己，不倾向任何人，你最好记住这一点。

String.Source: Of course. But, just as Sanguine brings merriment through desire, a selfish action may affect others in ways that seem selfless.
String.Dest: 当然了.但是，正如血腥凭借欲望给人以快感，一个自私的行为可能会以看似无私的方式影响到其他人。

String.Source: I am on nobody's side but my own. You'd do well to remember that.
String.Dest: 我只服务与自己，不倾向任何人，你最好记住这一点。

String.Source: You sought only personal glory and gain, but through this ambition, the balance of our world has been restored.
String.Dest: 你寻求的仅是个人荣誉和利益，但这野心会导致我们世界的平衡恢复到原先的样子。

String.Source: I am on nobody's side but my own. You'd do well to remember that.
String.Dest: 我只服务与自己，不倾向任何人，你最好记住这一点。

String.Source: Like Molag Bal, you swell with power, and if that power becomes a danger, Boethiah will strike from the shadows.
String.Dest: 就像莫拉格·巴尔, 你的能力随着这种力量不断增强，假如某天这力量变为威胁，那波耶西亚就会从黑暗中突袭而来.

String.Source: I am on nobody's side but my own. You'd do well to remember that.
String.Dest: 我只服务与自己，不倾向任何人，你最好记住这一点。

String.Source: This, you would do well to remember, for there is always a counterbalance, whether it be a formidable foe or a convincing idea.
String.Dest: 这一点，你要好好记住，总是有一个平衡的，无论是一个强大的敌人还一个有说服力的观点。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: That reminds me of a tale of the Khajiit who lost his wife. Upon her death, he promised her he would never remarry.
String.Dest: 这使我想起了一个关于一个丧妻的虎人的故事。妻子去世的时候，他答应过她永远不会再娶。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: She warned him that if he broke his promise, she would haunt him as a spirit for the rest of his life.
String.Dest: 她警告他说如果他背叛了自己的诺言，她就会化作鬼魂，后半生永远纠缠着他。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: His loneliness outweighed his guilt, and he fell in love with another. Sure enough, his dead wife began to haunt him.
String.Dest: 然而最终孤独战胜了他的内疚，他还是与别人产生了爱情。然后他亡妻的鬼魂就开始纠缠他了。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: The dead wife seemed to know everything. She knew about his forays to the brothel, and his gambling at the pits.
String.Dest: 妻子的鬼魂似乎什么都知道。她知道他冲进妓院的事情，也知道他在斗兽场赌博的事情。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: When he sought the guidance of the priest, the priest told him to ask the ghost a question even the man himself did not know.
String.Dest: 虎人向一名祭司寻求帮助，祭司叫他问妻子的幽灵一件连他自己也不知道的事情。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: For if she truly knew everything, then she was indeed a ghost. But if she knew only what the man knew, it was more likely he was haunting himself.
String.Dest: 因为如果她真的什么事情都知道，那么她就真的是一个幽灵。但如果她只知道这个男人知道的事情，那么这看起来更像是这个男人的愧疚感使他无法原谅他自己。

String.Source: And here I was feeling guilty about wanting to destroy you.
String.Dest: 对于刚刚我想杀了你，我感到很内疚。

String.Source: Such is the power of guilt, that it drives us to maintain our virtue.
String.Dest: 这就是愧疚的力量，它的存在使得我们能够维持我们的品德。

String.Source: Oh boy, here we go...
String.Dest: 来吧，我们走……

String.Source: In my vision I was standing in the atrium of a castle of glass, canvassed by an iridescent sky. In the stars I saw the Aedra and Daedra.
String.Dest: 在我的眼中，我正站在一座玻璃城堡的中庭，头上是绚丽的彩虹色天空。在星光中我仿佛看到了圣灵与魔神。

String.Source: Oh boy, here we go...
String.Dest: 来吧，我们走……

String.Source: They stood side by side, and beckoned me to follow a new path. One that made no distinction between the Gods. For one were all, and all were one.
String.Dest: 他们肩靠肩地站着, 然后招手示意我跟随一条新路径。众神中谁都没有区别。一即是万物，万物即是一。

String.Source: He never knew the thief's identity, did he.
String.Dest: 你从来都不知道他是小偷，对吧。

String.Source: That is one interpretation. The priestess, overwhelmed by her master's kindness, would realize the error of her ways.
String.Dest: 有一种说法。这名女祭司被祭司长的善良打动，认识到了自己所犯的错误。

String.Source: He never knew the thief's identity, did he.
String.Dest: 你从来都不知道他是小偷，对吧。

String.Source: Perhaps driven by guilt, she would expose herself as the thief, and through her bravery, truly achieve the forgiveness of her peers.
String.Dest: 也许出于愧疚感的驱使，她会站出来说明自己就是那个小偷，然后由于她的勇敢，她将真正获得其他人的宽恕。

String.Source: He never knew the thief's identity, did he.
String.Dest: 你从来都不知道他是小偷，对吧。

String.Source: For any other path would result in bitterness and resentment, although these provide their own lessons, should the head priest choose to teach them.
String.Dest: 因为通过其他途径最终会导致痛苦和怨恨，所以即使这些会让他们受到教训，但祭司长也应选择这样教他们。

String.Source: I agree. Control of Markarth will shift to the Jarl, and the city may benefit by a return to traditional politics.
String.Dest: I agree. Control of Markarth will shift to the Jarl, and the city may benefit by a return to traditional politics.

String.Source: They're both dead. Markarth is better off without either of them.
String.Dest: They're both dead. Markarth is better off without either of them.

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 不过只有时间才能证明我们所做之事的真正效果。我想起一个寓言，不知你有没有兴趣听。

String.Source: They're both dead. Markarth is better off without either of them.
String.Dest: They're both dead. Markarth is better off without either of them.

String.Source: An interesting proposition. Although I do not think what you mean is the island itself, but the people who reside there.
String.Dest: 这主意不错。虽然我不认为你所指的是岛屿本身，而是上面的居民才对。

String.Source: It's that island they live on. I bet it triples your magical abilities.
String.Dest: 那就是他们生活的岛屿，我打赌，一上去你的法力就能提升三倍。

String.Source: A monk once told me that if I spent a day around humor, by night I would be a jester, but by the morrow, I would revert to my former self.
String.Dest: 有个僧侣跟我说，如果我花一整天研究幽默，到了晚上就会变成个小丑，可第二天一早，就又变回我原来的自己了。

String.Source: It's that island they live on. I bet it triples your magical abilities.
String.Dest: 那就是他们生活的岛屿，我打赌，一上去你的法力就能提升三倍。

String.Source: Could it be that their isolation from the outside world sustains them? In this way they are always surrounded by magic, and tomorrow never comes.
String.Dest: 也许是他们与外界的隔离状态支撑着他们？这样他们会一直被魔法包围，第二天永远不会来到。

String.Source: It's that island they live on. I bet it triples your magical abilities.
String.Dest: 那就是他们生活的岛屿，我打赌，一上去你的法力就能提升三倍。

String.Source: I thank you, my friend, but I am no hunter. I do not long for mead halls or hunting grounds, but perhaps there is a place for me elsewhere.
String.Dest: 谢谢你，我的朋友。但我不是个猎人。我也不憧憬蜜酒大厅或是狩猎场，不过可能有别的地方适合我。

String.Source: The blessing of Hircine is a gift. You ought to try it.
String.Dest: 海尔辛的祝福是一种天赋。你太应该试一下了。

String.Source: This is not to disparage your choice, for in the end there are many paths, but no clear solution.
String.Dest: 条条大路通罗马，我不是否定你的选择，可并没有明确的方式。

String.Source: The blessing of Hircine is a gift. You ought to try it.
String.Dest: 海尔辛的祝福是一种天赋。你太应该试一下了。

String.Source: This is the fate of mortals in life and in death. We must make decisions based on incomplete information, from a group of imperfect choices.
String.Dest: 对于凡人来说，生死自有命。我们的从那些信息不完整的选择中做出决定。

String.Source: The blessing of Hircine is a gift. You ought to try it.
String.Dest: 海尔辛的祝福是一种天赋。你太应该试一下了。

String.Source: So you admit that Nocturnal's power holds sway over the darkness. It is not a corrupting force, however. The act of stealing is not always a crime.
String.Dest: 所以你承认诺克图娜尔的力量掌控着黑暗了。然而，这不是种破坏之力。偷窃行为并不总是犯罪。

String.Source: I did this for the Guild. Luck has been hard to come by.
String.Dest: 我这么做是为了公会。运气一直很差。

String.Source: Yet, your past disappointments keep you humble, and help balance the events of the present, when you have every reason to be arrogant.
String.Dest: 然而，你过去经受的挫折让你自卑。当你有足够的理由重获自信时，就帮忙协调目前的事件吧。

String.Source: I try not to think about the past myself. It's too depressing.
String.Dest: 我尽力不去回忆自己那伤感的过去. .

String.Source: This is why the Aedra and Daedra have saw fit to make you their champion. You accept power, but you do not necessarily seek it.
String.Dest: 这就是艾德拉和魔族让你成为他的战士的原因，你不必寻找它就能接受能力。

String.Source: I try not to think about the past myself. It's too depressing.
String.Dest: 我尽力不去回忆自己那伤感的过去. .

String.Source: How odd. I thought cats landed on their feet.
String.Dest: 真奇怪，我还以为猫都是用脚着地的。

String.Source: We Khajiit are quite adept, but the Divines saw fit to change that. When I struck my head on the ground, I lost consciousness, but gained clarity.
String.Dest: 我们虎人相当擅长于此，但圣灵们认为应该改变一下。当我的头撞到地上的时候，我失去了意识，思路却明晰了。

String.Source: How odd. I thought cats landed on their feet.
String.Dest: 真奇怪，我还以为猫都是用脚着地的。

String.Source: I saw Aedra and Daedra in the stars, side by side. They made no distinction between themselves. For one were all, and all were one.
String.Dest: 我看见圣灵与魔族在星辰上并肩而立。他们之间没什么区别。一即是万物，万物即是一。

String.Source: Which ones ask to me kill? Those are the ones I like.
String.Dest: 你要我杀掉哪一个？这几个都是我想做掉的。

String.Source: One should not simply follow the path of temptation without questioning why they are tempted.
String.Dest: 人不应该简单地被诱惑牵着鼻子走，而不去想想它为什么会产生诱惑力。

String.Source: Which ones ask to me kill? Those are the ones I like.
String.Dest: 你要我杀掉哪一个？这几个都是我想做掉的。

String.Source: For water has no form without a cauldron or bucket, nor do the moons have shape without the darkness to light them.
String.Dest: 就像没有容器，水就没有形状，没有黑暗的衬托，我们也不会看清双月的轮廓一样。

String.Source: I worship myself. It's working out pretty well for me.
String.Dest: 我崇拜我自己。这对我来说很有用。

String.Source: The mortal who makes a temple of himself neglects himself. For it is our relationship with others that allow our hearts and minds to prosper.
String.Dest: 那个为自己建造一座庙宇的凡人将忽略掉自身。因为正是我们与他人之间的种种关系才使得我们的心灵和思想渐渐成长。

String.Source: It's nothing to write home about.
String.Dest: 这不是什么值得大书特书的事。

String.Source: Strange, for the accounts I heard speak of a great wonder, a statue so grand it holds the sun and the moon in its palms.
String.Dest: 真奇怪，我听说过一个伟大的奇迹，说的是一座掌中托着太阳与月亮的巨大雕像。

String.Source: It's nothing to write home about.
String.Dest: 这不是什么值得大书特书的事。

String.Source: However, such is the mortal understanding of things. It lies in the concept rather than the object.
String.Dest: 然而这就是凡人理解事物的方式。在于事物代表的概念而不是事物本身。

String.Source: It's nothing to write home about.
String.Dest: 这不是什么值得大书特书的事。

String.Source: When that concept is twisted, we do not see things as they are. Our minds are distorted by the running water.
String.Dest: 当事物的概念被扭曲的时候，我们就难以看到其本质。于是我们的思维也随之歪曲了。

String.Source: It's nothing to write home about.
String.Dest: 这不是什么值得大书特书的事。

String.Source: Yet our reflections can only be seen when the river is calm. Only then can we bestow the Daedra their rightful place in the balance of all things.
String.Dest: 只有在河水平静的时候我们才能看见自己在水中的倒影，同样只有这样，我们才可以在万物平衡当中端正自己对于魔族的心态，把它们放到本该所处的位置上。

String.Source: In this world there are good intentions gone bad, and beautiful mistakes.
String.Dest: 世界上有很多好心做成了坏事，也有很多错误变成好事。

String.Source: Such is the complexity of life, for all intentions, all actions, flow on the waves of balance.
String.Dest: 生命的复杂性也是如此，因为所有的想法、所有的行为都在平衡的波浪中流动。

String.Source: In this world there are good intentions gone bad, and beautiful mistakes.
String.Dest: 世界上有很多好心做成了坏事，也有很多错误变成好事。

String.Source: There is the story of a monk who traveled through a busy market, where a butcher was peddling his meats.
String.Dest: 有这样一个故事，一名修道士穿过热闹的市场，屠夫正沿街叫卖着肉。

String.Source: In this world there are good intentions gone bad, and beautiful mistakes.
String.Dest: 世界上有很多好心做成了坏事，也有很多错误变成好事。

String.Source: The monk asked the butcher which meat was the tastiest, and the butcher promptly replied, "All of it. Everything I sell is tastier than the other."
String.Dest: 这名僧侣问屠夫哪块肉最好吃，屠夫迅速回答说，“它们全都很好吃。我卖的每一块肉都比别处更好吃。”

String.Source: In this world there are good intentions gone bad, and beautiful mistakes.
String.Dest: 世界上有很多好心做成了坏事，也有很多错误变成好事。

String.Source: And when the monk understood the butcher's lies were true, he gained a fragment of wisdom.
String.Dest: 当僧侣领悟到屠夫所说的其实并非谎言的时候，他顿觉醍醐灌顶。

String.Source: You beat them, that's how.
String.Dest: 你击败了他们，这怎么办到的。

String.Source: That is a method preferred by many monks. Some beat with a stick. Others use a bucket and sponge.
String.Dest: 那是一种被很多修道士偏爱的方法。有些修道士用木棍击打，其他人用水桶和海绵。

String.Source: You beat them, that's how.
String.Dest: 你击败了他们，这怎么办到的。

String.Source: There is a tale of a monk who worked a disciple to death, for failing to pray to the Divines before eating his meal.
String.Dest: 这个故事讲的是一名修道士让他的弟子一直干活直到累死，原因是他吃饭前没向诸神念餐前祝文。

String.Source: You beat them, that's how.
String.Dest: 你击败了他们，这怎么办到的。

String.Source: The disciple's father stormed up the temple steps, before kneeling and thanking the monk for the patience he showed with his foolish son.
String.Dest: 弟子的父亲疯狂地冲上了神庙的台阶，却未曾对这名修道士为他愚蠢的儿子耗尽心思而跪拜或是感谢。

String.Source: Well met traveler. I am Qa'Dojo, a monk making the pilgrimage to the Shrine of Azura.
String.Dest: 见到你很高兴，旅行者。我是奎兜啾，一名向着阿祖拉祭坛的方向进行朝圣之旅的修道士。

String.Source: You'll enjoy it. It's very statuesque.
String.Dest: 你会喜欢它。这看起来体态非常的优美。

String.Source: Yes, the Shrine of Azura is said to be one of the great wonders of Tamriel, built by the Dunmer to pay homage to the Daedric Prince.
String.Dest: 是的，阿祖拉的祭坛被誉为泰姆瑞尔大陆上最伟大的奇迹之一。据说矮人为了向魔神王子展现他们的敬意而建造了它。

String.Source: You'll enjoy it. It's very statuesque.
String.Dest: 你会喜欢它。这看起来体态非常的优美。

String.Source: I have heard that she does indeed look east to Morrowind, offering sanctuary to her humble servants.
String.Dest: 我听说她确实是望向东方的晨风，并为她虔诚的拥护者提供庇护。

String.Source: You'll enjoy it. It's very statuesque.
String.Dest: 你会喜欢它。这看起来体态非常的优美。

String.Source: Some may frown upon worship of the Daedra, as if the Aedra held a monopoly on the forces of good.
String.Dest: 有的人可能会对她魔族的身份感到反感，就好像只有圣灵才能垄断代表正义的力量。

String.Source: You'll enjoy it. It's very statuesque.
String.Dest: 你会喜欢它。这看起来体态非常的优美。

String.Source: When in truth, both the Aedra and the Daedra are capable of love and mercy.
String.Dest: 而事实上，不管是圣灵还是魔族，他们都能够心怀爱与仁慈。

String.Source: One must not focus on a person's chest, lest they neglect the person's bottom.
String.Dest: 我们不能老是看着别人的胸部，这会使得无法看清那个人的本质。

String.Source: You could not join a monastery. They say that a monk must avoid the carnal pursuits to achieve true wisdom.
String.Dest: 你加入不了修道院的。他们说一名修道士必须戒欲才能实现真正的智慧。

String.Source: One must not focus on a person's chest, lest they neglect the person's bottom.
String.Dest: 我们不能老是看着别人的胸部，这会使得无法看清那个人的本质。

String.Source: Some will deny all contact with their desires, for fear they will succumb to weakness.
String.Dest: 有些人会全盘拒绝接触他们渴望的事情，因为他们害怕自己会屈服于自己的软弱。

String.Source: One must not focus on a person's chest, lest they neglect the person's bottom.
String.Dest: 我们不能老是看着别人的胸部，这会使得无法看清那个人的本质。

String.Source: However, while lustful objects are not present in the room, they are present in the mind.
String.Dest: 然而那些欲望和诱惑即使不在他们眼前出现，它们也会出现在脑海里，意识中。

String.Source: One must not focus on a person's chest, lest they neglect the person's bottom.
String.Dest: 我们不能老是看着别人的胸部，这会使得无法看清那个人的本质。

String.Source: It is better to leave such thoughts with the objects in question than with the imagination.
String.Dest: 对于那样的想法，把它们当做一种尚有疑问的观点要比将它们想像成具体的事物好一点。

String.Source: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.
String.Dest: 那时我最在乎的就是逃出去，跟他们谁都无关。

String.Source: And still, so many things change based on a single action. Your escape is Madanach's freedom, and Markarth's war.
String.Dest: 另外，很多事物因简单的行为而改变。你逃避则迈德纳奇自由，同时马卡斯城引来战争。

String.Source: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.
String.Dest: 那时我最在乎的就是逃出去，跟他们谁都无关。

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 不过只有时间才能证明我们所做之事的真正效果。我想起一个寓言，不知你有没有兴趣听。

String.Source: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.
String.Dest: 那时我最在乎的就是逃出去，跟他们谁都无关。

String.Source: And still, so many things change based on a single action. Your escape is Madanach's death, and Thonar's gain.
String.Dest: 另外，很多事物因简单的行为而改变。你逃避则迈德纳奇自由，同时马卡斯城陷入战火。

String.Source: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.
String.Dest: 那时我最在乎的就是逃出去，跟他们谁都无关。

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 不过只有时间才能证明我们所做之事的真正效果。我想起一个寓言，不知你有没有兴趣听。

String.Source: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.
String.Dest: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.

String.Source: And still, so many things change based on a single action. Your escape led to death of Thonar and Madanach, and the city is the Jarl's once more.
String.Dest: And still, so many things change based on a single action. Your escape led to death of Thonar and Madanach, and the city is the Jarl's once more.

String.Source: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.
String.Dest: My chief concern was escape. It wasn't about either of them.

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.

String.Source: It is their devotion to the Old Ways that give the Psijics power.
String.Dest: 他们对古老之道的奉献会给予赛伊克人力量。

String.Source: I see. That would explain why in all their years, the Mages' Guild never matched the power of the Psijics, despite being founded by a former monk.
String.Dest: 我懂了。这就解释了法师公会同样是先前的修道士创建，但这些年来力量完全不能与赛伊克人匹敌的原因。

String.Source: It is their devotion to the Old Ways that give the Psijics power.
String.Dest: 他们对古老之道的奉献会给予赛伊克人力量。

String.Source: Vanus Galerion sought a change to the Old Ways to bring magic to the world, yet it is almost as if that diluted its strength.
String.Dest: 万纳斯·加里兰试图改变将魔法之力引到这个世界的老方法，但是好像那基本上只能削弱魔法的强度。

String.Source: It is their devotion to the Old Ways that give the Psijics power.
String.Dest: 他们对古老之道的奉献会给予赛伊克人力量。

String.Source: One wonders if the power of Aetherius is a limited resource, like iron or gold, and the Psijics move their island in order to tap veins of energy.
String.Dest: 我好奇光界的力量是否如铁矿或金矿那样，是不可再生资源，而赛伊克教团是为了捕捉光界的能流而移动他们的小岛。

String.Source: It is their devotion to the Old Ways that give the Psijics power.
String.Dest: 他们对古老之道的奉献会给予赛伊克人力量。

String.Source: In that sense, the Elder Way is a strategy of conservation. A way to hoard the power of Aetherius for to chosen few. An interesting thought.
String.Dest: 在这一意义上，上古之道是一种保护策略。一种为被选中的少数人积蓄艾瑟瑞斯之力的方式。真有趣。

String.Source: It may be a gift to some, but it's a curse to me.
String.Dest: 对某些人来说或许是个礼赞，但对我来说那不过只是个挥之不去的梦魇。

String.Source: I disagree that it is a curse, for that word carries with it a negative connotation.
String.Dest: 诅咒这个词不怎么恰当吧，它可不是什么褒义词。

String.Source: It may be a gift to some, but it's a curse to me.
String.Dest: 对某些人来说或许是个礼赞，但对我来说那不过只是个挥之不去的梦魇。

String.Source: It is simply another option, one that is not suitable for you and a few of your Shield-Siblings.
String.Dest: 这单纯是另一种选择，一种不太适合你也不太适合你某几个盾牌同胞的选择。

String.Source: It may be a gift to some, but it's a curse to me.
String.Dest: 对某些人来说或许是个礼赞，但对我来说那不过只是个挥之不去的梦魇。

String.Source: We should not disparage those who choose it, however, for in the end there are many paths, but no clear solution.
String.Dest: 无论是谁选择了它，我们都不应看不起，不管怎样，因为在最后都会有很多方法，但并没有明确的方式。

String.Source: It may be a gift to some, but it's a curse to me.
String.Dest: 对某些人来说或许是个礼赞，但对我来说那不过只是个挥之不去的梦魇。

String.Source: This is the fate of mortals in life and in death. We must make decisions based on incomplete information, from a group of imperfect choices.
String.Dest: 对于凡人来说，生死自有命。我们的从那些信息不完整的选择中做出决定。

String.Source: I don't care for Nocturnal. Karliah thought it was necessary so I played along.
String.Dest: 我才不在乎什么诺克图娜尔. 只是卡莉亚觉得有必要，我就配合一下而已。

String.Source: Still, you formed the trinity, if not for your own sake, but for the others. Nocturnal's influence is an important part of their lives.
String.Dest: 不过，如果不是为了你自己，而是为了其他人的话，你应该和他俩共进退。诺克图娜尔的影响在他们生命中至关重要。

String.Source: I like to reminisce as well. About all the throats I've cut.
String.Dest: 我也喜欢回忆。回忆那些被我杀死的人。

String.Source: The Gods made you what you are, and it cannot be helped.
String.Dest: 众神把你捏成啥样儿就啥样儿，这是天生的，没救了。

String.Source: I like to reminisce as well. About all the throats I've cut.
String.Dest: 我也喜欢回忆。回忆那些被我杀死的人。

String.Source: Just know that while you dream of the past, there are those who dream of a day when the throat that's cut is yours.
String.Dest: Just know that while you dream of the past, there are those who dream of a day when the throat that's cut is yours.

String.Source: Explain this doctrine of yours.
String.Dest: 请解释一下你们的教义。

String.Source: I follow the path of balance through opposition. The Aedra and Daedra are the embodiment of this mantra.
String.Dest: 我通过对立来追求平衡之道，而魔族与圣灵的对立正是这奇妙平衡的具体表现。

String.Source: Explain this doctrine of yours.
String.Dest: 请解释一下你们的教义。

String.Source: It is a common misconception that these balancing forces are the spirit of good and evil. A reductive and flawed interpretation.
String.Dest: 这种相互平衡的力量经常被误解为正义与邪恶的精神力量，不得不说这种误解充满人类的臆想与揣测。

String.Source: Explain this doctrine of yours.
String.Dest: 请解释一下你们的教义。

String.Source: The Aedra are the agents of stasis and order. The Daedra are the essence of change and chaos. For chaos itself cannot be an agent of anything.
String.Dest: 圣灵代表着静态和秩序，魔族是改变和混乱的化身。至于混乱本身却不能代表任何事情。

String.Source: Explain this doctrine of yours.
String.Dest: 请解释一下你们的教义。

String.Source: When the two are in balance, time progresses at its natural flow. The world changes as it stays the same.
String.Dest: 当这二者处于平衡状态时，时间就会按照本身的自然状态流动。世界是静止的，同时它也在变化着。

String.Source: Explain this doctrine of yours.
String.Dest: 请解释一下你们的教义。

String.Source: Although in truth, it is not for us to attach labels to the creators.
String.Dest: 然而事实是，我们是没资格给创始者们随便扣帽子的。

String.Source: Explain this doctrine of yours.
String.Dest: 请解释一下你们的教义。

String.Source: If mortals cannot divine the nature of themselves, it is quite presumptuous to try the same with the Gods.
String.Dest: 如果凡人连他们自己的本质都无法预知，那么如此去揣测神的本质则更显放肆无礼。

String.Source: Not everyday I meet a Daedric monk.
String.Dest: 这可不是天天都能见到一个魔族修道士啊。

String.Source: Then today will be no different than any other.
String.Dest: 那今天就与以往的日子没有任何区别。

String.Source: Not everyday I meet a Daedric monk.
String.Dest: 这可不是天天都能见到一个魔族修道士啊。

String.Source: For while I recognize Azura's place in the pantheon of the Divines, the Daedra hold no particular favor in the doctrine I follow.
String.Dest: 虽然我认为阿祖拉在诸圣灵中拥有一席之地，但魔族并没有特别青眛我的教条。

String.Source: Not everyday I meet a Daedric monk.
String.Dest: 这可不是天天都能见到一个魔族修道士啊。

String.Source: Some may see the line between Aedra and Daedra as a means of separation, when the divide itself is the true nature of our existence.
String.Dest: 有的人可能把圣灵与魔族之间分的很清楚，然而对于我们来说，分隔本身是我们存在的真实本质。

String.Source: Not everyday I meet a Daedric monk.
String.Dest: 这可不是天天都能见到一个魔族修道士啊。

String.Source: It is in the eye of the storm that one finds balance, and with balance comes the flourishing of life.
String.Dest: 只有在暴风眼中才能寻得平衡，只有平衡才能衍生出生生不息的生命。

String.Source: I have more questions regarding your philosophy.
String.Dest: 我有更多的关于你的哲学的问题。

String.Source: Then I implore you to ask them. To ask a question is to risk being a fool, but to cling to silence is to remain one.
String.Dest: 那么我希望你把这些都问题提出来。虽然问问题可能会被人当成愚蠢的人，但是保持沉默才是最愚蠢的行为。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: The other students jeered. They saw the frustration on his face, and suggested he use the calm spell on himself first.
String.Dest: 其他同学都乐了。他们看到他脸上的窘态，建议他先给自己来一发平静术。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: The monk continued to cast spell after spell in vain. He wanted to quit, to end his humiliation, but the master would not allow it.
String.Dest: 这个修道士在施法失败后一直在尝试。他想放弃，想抛弃他自己的人性，但是大师不会允许这么做的。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: He realized that the only way out was to drive the dog into a frenzy and force the master to kill it.
String.Dest: 他意识到唯一的办法就是让狗发狂，迫使主人去杀掉它。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: And so, distracted by neither desire, ambition, pride nor shame, he cast the spell once more and the dog fell into a deep sleep.
String.Dest: 这一次，没有被任何因素干扰，欲望，野心，骄傲或者耻辱……他又一次施展了那个法术，让那条狗深深地沉睡了。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: The apprentice was distraught, but the master was not angry. He looked at the young monk, his eyes rinsed in the moonlight, and said these words:
String.Dest: 学徒被吓坏了，但大师没有生气。他注视着这个年轻的修道士，目光似月般澄澈，说出如下话语：

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: Failure is but an opportunity to learn. What you have seen is what happens when you try to tip the scales of chaos and order.
String.Dest: Failure is but an opportunity to learn. What you have seen is what happens when you try to tip the scales of chaos and order.

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: The Vigilants of Stendarr are much like the apprentice. They seek to restore order, but to eliminate chaos is to tamper with balance.
String.Dest: 斯丹达尔警戒者就像天真的学徒一样。他们试图恢复秩序，但事实恰恰相反，消除混沌便是干扰平衡。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: Smiling, he penned a note to the Arkay priest, informing him of his foolishness.
String.Dest: 微笑着,他写下了一张便条,告诉阿尔凯牧师他的愚笨。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: Yet as he set off to deliver it, a mischievous boy stole the missive from his hand.
String.Dest: 但当他动身去交付它时，一个调皮的男孩从他手里偷信件。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: The Khajiit chased him up a roof, only to watch as the boy shredded the letter into flakes of snow.
String.Dest: 虎人在一个屋顶上抓到了他，却只能眼睁睁的看着男孩儿把信撕成了碎片。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: Months later, the Khajiit is walking up the steps to the temple, when he hears an apprentice call his late master's name.
String.Dest: 几个月后，那个虎人终于抵达了神殿，就在那时，他突然听到有个学徒叫着他最后一任主人的名字。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: Surprised, he looks to his left, and then to his right, and only when he sees nothing does he realize the master they beckon is him.
String.Dest: 惊奇的是，他左瞧瞧，再右瞧瞧，当他什么也没发现时才明白大师叫的是他。

String.Source: (The Gildergreen) Tell me this parable you speak of.
String.Dest: (翠苒树)告诉我你谈到的比喻。

String.Source: A young khajiit monk is called to the temple, where his master waits with grave news.
String.Dest: 一个年轻的虎人修道士被叫去了神殿，他的主人在那里等着他，要告诉他一个重大消息。

String.Source: (The Gildergreen) Tell me this parable you speak of.
String.Dest: (翠苒树)告诉我你谈到的比喻。

String.Source: A priest of Arkay says that in three days time, snow will fall in the summer, and when the last flake falls the master will die.
String.Dest: 有个阿尔凯祭司把这话念了三天，那夏天会有一场大雪，最后一片雪花落下时，主人也就升天啦。

String.Source: (The Gildergreen) Tell me this parable you speak of.
String.Dest: (翠苒树)告诉我你谈到的比喻。

String.Source: Surely he jests, the young apprentice offered, but the master was resolute. "I return to nothing," he replied, "and from nothing I will return."
String.Dest: Surely he jests, the young apprentice offered, but the master was resolute. "I return to nothing," he replied, "and from nothing I will return."

String.Source: (The Gildergreen) Tell me this parable you speak of.
String.Dest: (翠苒树)告诉我你谈到的比喻。

String.Source: Three days passed, and on the third day, the Khajiit looked to the sky, and found only the scorching sun.
String.Dest: 三天过去了，在第三天，虎人望向天空，只见到炎炎烈日。

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: In the summer, the sweltering heat brought a plague of mosquitoes upon a Khajiit master's temple.
String.Dest: 在那个夏天，令人窒息的闷热使得一座虎人大师神庙里的蚊子泛滥成灾。

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: Although dragonflies hunted mosquitoes, the alchemists had ravaged their numbers. An apprentice suggested introducing a new predator.
String.Dest: 虽然蜻蜓会吃蚊虫，炼金术士们还是苦于蚊虫的数量众多。一个学徒建议引进一种新的蚊虫捕食者。

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: A trader had brought a species of toad from the forests of Valenwood. It held no alchemical properties, and was poisonous to predators.
String.Dest: 一个贸易商带来了一种原产于威木省森林的蟾蜍。它不具有炼金特性，对肉食者而言是有毒的。

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: Within days, the mosquito population had diminished. However, the toad's appetite could not be sated by mere insects.
String.Dest: 几天内这群蚊子就被消灭了。但蟾蜍的胃口可不是几只昆虫就能满足的。

String.Source: (Hall of the Vigilant) Enlighten me.
String.Dest: (警戒者会堂) 请教教我吧。

String.Source: Rodents, reptiles, and even small birds fell prey to this voracious hunter. In time, only the toads were left.
String.Dest: 啮齿动物，爬行动物，甚至小鸟儿都成为了这个贪婪猎人的牺牲品。最后，只有蟾蜍幸免于难。

String.Source: (Winterhold) Alright. Tell me a story, monk.
String.Dest: (冬堡) 好的大师，给我讲个故事吧。

String.Source: A young monk, just out of the litter, trained at the temple in the art of casting spells.
String.Dest: 一个年轻的僧侣，刚刚离开自己的小窝，在修道院里接受了艺术班的施法培训。

String.Source: (Winterhold) Alright. Tell me a story, monk.
String.Dest: (冬堡) 好的大师，给我讲个故事吧。

String.Source: Although many of the students were his seniors, there was one female Wood Elf with whom he shared an age, and they became fast friends.
String.Dest: 即使很多学生都是他的长者，这里面还是有一个女性木精灵和他一起共同度日，并且还和他成了挚友。

String.Source: (Winterhold) Alright. Tell me a story, monk.
String.Dest: (冬堡) 好的大师，给我讲个故事吧。

String.Source: The first lesson was in illusion. The master cast a fury spell on a stray hound, and each student took turns calming it.
String.Dest: 第一节是幻术课。大师给流浪狗施展愤怒法术，然后每个学生都得试着让狗平静下来。

String.Source: (Winterhold) Alright. Tell me a story, monk.
String.Dest: (冬堡) 好的大师，给我讲个故事吧。

String.Source: The monk wanted very much to impress the young Elf. Yet his attempts to calm the beast failed, and each subsequent attempt only incensed it further.
String.Dest: 修道士非常想给年轻的精灵留下印象。但他想让它平静下来的企图都失败了，每次尝试的结果都只是让它更愤怒。

String.Source: That's crazy talk. Daedra aren't Divines. They're evil.
String.Dest: 这真是胡说八道。魔族是不是圣灵。他们是邪恶的。

String.Source: A Nord man lies in the field and sleeps away the day. His family lives on the brink of starvation, unable to extricate themselves from their poverty
String.Dest: 一名诺德人躺在田地并睡了一整天。他的家人生活在饥饿边缘，贫穷如影随形。

String.Source: That's crazy talk. Daedra aren't Divines. They're evil.
String.Dest: 这真是胡说八道。魔族是不是圣灵。他们是邪恶的。

String.Source: One day a wayward sabrecat stalks through the field. It attacks the man, wounding him severely before he manages to flee.
String.Dest: 有一天，一头狡猾的剑齿虎悄悄接近了田地。在那诺德人艰难地跑出田地前，它袭击并重创了他。

String.Source: That's crazy talk. Daedra aren't Divines. They're evil.
String.Dest: 这真是胡说八道。魔族是不是圣灵。他们是邪恶的。

String.Source: With the husband bedridden, the wife awakes from her stupor. She weaves fabrics and works the field to provide for her children.
String.Dest: 由于丈夫重伤卧床不起，她的妻子不得不振作起来。她编织布料和在田里做活来养活孩子。

String.Source: That's crazy talk. Daedra aren't Divines. They're evil.
String.Dest: 这真是胡说八道。魔族是不是圣灵。他们是邪恶的。

String.Source: The man's son learns to hunt. He seeks revenge on the sabrecat that nearly killed his father.
String.Dest: 那个男人的儿子也开始学习狩猎。他要找到那只差点杀死他父亲的剑齿虎并复仇。

String.Source: That's crazy talk. Daedra aren't Divines. They're evil.
String.Dest: 这真是胡说八道。魔族是不是圣灵。他们是邪恶的。

String.Source: The man's daughter trains in alchemy, to help restore her father's vigor.
String.Dest: 那男人的女儿则是为了帮助她父亲维持生命开始学习。

String.Source: That's crazy talk. Daedra aren't Divines. They're evil.
String.Dest: 这真是胡说八道。魔族是不是圣灵。他们是邪恶的。

String.Source: As the children mature, the family becomes a valuable pillar of the village. One might say they have the sabrecat to thank.
String.Dest: 当孩子们长大成人之后，这个家庭成了整个村子的中流砥柱。有些人甚至认为他们应该感谢当初那只剑齿虎。

String.Source: Do you think there will come a time when dragons and mortals co-exist?
String.Dest: 你觉得会不会有一天龙族能跟人类和平共处呢？

String.Source: This I do not know. Things that cannot adapt to the world's natural harmony will inevitably become extinct.
String.Dest: 我不懂这个。物竞天择,适者生存。

String.Source: Do you think there will come a time when dragons and mortals co-exist?
String.Dest: 你觉得会不会有一天龙族能跟人类和平共处呢？

String.Source: This Way of the Voice, however, may provide a solution. Much like in the parable of the ill-tempered Khajiit, anger is a choice.
String.Dest: 这吼声之道，无论如何，可能会提供一个解决方案。就像这个寓言中脾气暴躁的虎人，愤怒也是一种选择。

String.Source: Do you think there will come a time when dragons and mortals co-exist?
String.Dest: 你觉得会不会有一天龙族能跟人类和平共处呢？

String.Source: This I do not know. Things that cannot adapt to the world's natural harmony will inevitably become extinct.
String.Dest: 我不懂这个。物竞天择,适者生存。

String.Source: Do you think there will come a time when dragons and mortals co-exist?
String.Dest: 你觉得会不会有一天龙族能跟人类和平共处呢？

String.Source: This Way of the Voice, however, may provide a solution. Much like in the parable of the ill-tempered Khajiit, anger is a choice.
String.Dest: 这吼声之道，无论如何，可能会提供一个解决方案。就像这个寓言中脾气暴躁的虎人，愤怒也是一种选择。

String.Source: Do you think there will come a time when dragons and mortals co-exist?
String.Dest: 你觉得会不会有一天龙族能跟人类和平共处呢？

String.Source: However, as the dragon who preached it is slain, it is far more likely that should the dragons be reborn again, it will end in their demise or ours.
String.Dest: 可是,就像那头说是被宰了的龙一样, 更有可能的是，龙再次复活，最后以它们或者我们的死亡而结束

String.Source: What did the monk say?
String.Dest: 那个僧侣说了什么？

String.Source: The monk replied, "Because you are never ill, you do not pray at the Temple."
String.Dest: 修道士回答说，“因为你从不生病，所以你不在神殿里祈祷。”

String.Source: What did the monk say?
String.Dest: 那个僧侣说了什么？

String.Source: You care not for the trifles of a monk, or the value of another's friendship. There is little point, you believe, for you will outlive them all.
String.Dest: You care not for the trifles of a monk, or the value of another's friendship. There is little point, you believe, for you will outlive them all.

String.Source: What did the monk say?
String.Dest: 那个僧侣说了什么？

String.Source: You are afflicted with the disease of life. And thus, you have not the means to treasure it.
String.Dest: You are afflicted with the disease of life. And thus, you have not the means to treasure it.

String.Source: What did the monk say?
String.Dest: 那个僧侣说了什么？

String.Source: With that, the Elf laid a septim in the monk's palm. And every day after, one could find him at the shrines, in the markets, or with a friend.
String.Dest: 接着，那个精灵给了僧人一个金币。在那之后的每一天你都会发现他在市场的神龛前，有时和一个朋友一起。

String.Source: Alright, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听。

String.Source: All right, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，说来让我们听听。

String.Source: There was a once a young Elf who lived in a village, but only young by appearance.
String.Dest: 曾经有个年轻的精灵居住在一个小村子里，但只是看上去年轻罢了。

String.Source: He had been in the village for thousands of years, yet his face was no older than a season.
String.Dest: 他已经在村里生活了好几千年，但他的面容始终未变。

String.Source: Alright, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听。

String.Source: All right, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，说来让我们听听。

String.Source: One day the Elf happened upon a traveling monk. The monk was dressed in rags, poor and disheveled, seeking alms in exchange for healing.
String.Dest: 一天，精灵发现一个云游僧，这云游僧破衣烂衫，看起来十分贫穷与落魄，以治疗作为交换乞求他人的施舍。

String.Source: Alright, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听。

String.Source: All right, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，说来让我们听听。

String.Source: The monk asked the Elf if he would pay him a Septim in exchange for his services. The Elf balked at the notion. He was in perfect health.
String.Dest: 僧人问那个精灵是否愿意拿一块钱买他的服务。精灵断然拒绝。他的身体好得很。

String.Source: Alright, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听。

String.Source: All right, let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，说来让我们听听。

String.Source: When the bee is drawn to the flowers for nectar, it serves to pollinate the entire garden.
String.Dest: 当一只蜜蜂被一朵花的花蜜吸引之后，它也将为整座花园授粉。

String.Source: So slavery, rape, and destruction are part of the grand scheme. Good to know.
String.Dest: 因此，奴役，强奸，毁灭都是这个宏伟计划的一部分？了解了。

String.Source: It is not clear whether the machinery of life is driven by motive, or works to shape it. What is clear is that all things depend on each other.
String.Dest: 尚不清楚生命的运转到底是被自身的动机还是产生生命的程式所驱使。已经清楚的是，所有的事物都与其他事物息息相关。

String.Source: So slavery, rape, and destruction are part of the grand scheme. Good to know.
String.Dest: 因此，奴役，强奸，毁灭都是这个宏伟计划的一部分？了解了。

String.Source: Removing the Daedra from this plane would disrupt the balance of life, like burning a hive of bees in response to a few stings.
String.Dest: 如果将魔族从世界中抹除，那么生命的平衡将被扰乱，这就像因为几次蛰痛而烧掉整个蜂巢一样。

String.Source: So slavery, rape, and destruction are part of the grand scheme. Good to know.
String.Dest: 因此，奴役，强奸，毁灭都是这个宏伟计划的一部分？了解了。

String.Source: Yet I will not admonish those who resent the Gods, or punish them for their hate. For hate itself is its own punishment, as it works to consume them.
String.Dest: 然而我并不会去劝告那些怨恨着神的人们，也不会去惩戒他们的恨意。因为仇恨本身就是一种惩罚，它将慢慢磨损人的生命力。

String.Source: So slavery, rape, and destruction are part of the grand scheme. Good to know.
String.Dest: 因此，奴役，强奸，毁灭都是这个宏伟计划的一部分？了解了。

String.Source: Boethiah is the Prince of plots, deceit, and conspiracy. Such words are sinister when spoken in the void.
String.Dest: 波耶西亚是阴谋、欺骗与叛乱的魔神巨头。这几个词一说出来的时候，仿佛空气中都盘旋着阴险的气氛。

String.Source: Is it possible that some Daedra can be categorized as evil?
String.Dest: 是有可能，一些魔族可以被归类为邪恶？

String.Source: Yet when the scales of power tip toward tyranny, when the strength of the dishonorable cannot be vanquished by a frontal assault, Boethiah is there.
String.Dest: 然而当权力的天平倒向暴君之时，当正面对抗无法消灭那些卑鄙无耻的势力之时，波耶西亚就会出现。

String.Source: Is it possible that some Daedra can be categorized as evil?
String.Dest: 是有可能，一些魔族可以被归类为邪恶？

String.Source: Molag Bal, meanwhile, is her nemesis, for he is strength and domination, and those who enslave others do so in his name.
String.Dest: 莫拉格·巴尔是她的主要敌人，因为他代表了强权与支配，也代表着那些以巴尔之名奴役他人无恶不作的恶徒。

String.Source: Is it possible that some Daedra can be categorized as evil?
String.Dest: 是有可能，一些魔族可以被归类为邪恶？

String.Source: Although Boethiah teaches us that strength can be vanquished, Molag Bal demonstrates that weakness is not a virtue.
String.Dest: 虽然波耶西亚教导我们强权是可以被击溃的，但莫拉格．巴尔同时也证明了软弱并不是一种美德。

String.Source: Is it possible that some Daedra can be categorized as evil?
String.Dest: 是有可能，一些魔族可以被归类为邪恶？

String.Source: Mehrunes Dagon is the facilitator of destruction, the great equalizer of this plane.
String.Dest: 梅鲁涅斯．大衮是毁灭的促进者，在这个世界扮演着重要作用的平衡者。

String.Source: Is it possible that some Daedra can be categorized as evil?
String.Dest: 是有可能，一些魔族可以被归类为邪恶？

String.Source: For when life is allowed to grow unchecked, it will wither from its own abundance.
String.Dest: 因为当生命被允许不受抑制地生长之时，它反而会因自己的过度放纵而凋零。

String.Source: Is it possible that some Daedra can be categorized as evil?
String.Dest: 是有可能，一些魔族可以被归类为邪恶？

String.Source: The path of balance requires you to steel your heart against that which is deplorable, and calm your emotions at that which brings you joy.
String.Dest: 追求平衡之道将让你不以物喜，不以己悲。

String.Source: I can respect that.
String.Dest: 我尊重这一点。

String.Source: It is through the evenness of mind that one can see through the shroud of passion, and be blessed with the clarity of enlightenment.
String.Dest: 正是通过达到心灵的平衡才使得智慧可以穿透被情绪笼罩的迷雾，最终得到清晰启迪的祝福。

String.Source: I can respect that.
String.Dest: 我尊重这一点。

String.Source: The painting was hung over the bed chamber, and while it seemed to be a perfect fit, the Count nevertheless told the carpenter to take it down.
String.Dest: 画被挂在了卧室，虽然看上去它摆放的位置是那么完美，但伯爵仍旧让木匠取下来。

String.Source: All right. Tell me the story.
String.Dest: 好的，把整件事说给我听听。

String.Source: Back and forth the pair went, from the study to the great hall, each time the Count requesting the carpenter to hang the painting, then remove it.
String.Dest: 他俩就在书房和大厅之间徘徊，伯爵一次又一次地要求木匠挂上然后又取下那幅画。

String.Source: All right. Tell me the story.
String.Dest: 好的，把整件事说给我听听。

String.Source: After walking the breadth of the castle, at long last they returned to the bed chamber.
String.Dest: 在逛遍了整个城堡后了之后，他们又把它挂回了卧室。

String.Source: All right. Tell me the story.
String.Dest: 好的，把整件事说给我听听。

String.Source: Only this time, when the painting was hung, the Count was satisfied, for only by seeing all other alternatives did he know his choice was true.
String.Dest: 只有这一次，当那幅油画被挂起的时候，伯爵显得很满意。因为只有看过了所有其他的油画，他才能肯定他最终的选择是正确的。

String.Source: All right. Tell me the story.
String.Dest: 好的，把整件事说给我听听。

String.Source: And thus my request is this. If you will do me the honor of being my carpenter, and I yours, then I will forever be in your debt.
String.Dest: 因此我的要求是这样的。如果你愿意赏光做我的木匠，那我就是你的，我将永远都欠你一份人情。

String.Source: All right. Tell me the story.
String.Dest: 好的，把整件事说给我听听。

String.Source: Hm...one must have both purpose and flexibility. He may walk a path of many roads to the same destination.
String.Dest: 呃，一个人必须目的与灵活性兼备。他应该有很多种方法达成同样目标。

String.Source: Do you plan on staying in Skyrim?
String.Dest: 你计划待在天际省？

String.Source: He may not know where the destination lies until the moment he arrives at it, and even then, it may not fulfill his true purpose.
String.Dest: 在在真正完成之前，其实根本没有什么最后的结果可言；甚至到最后，结局也可能并不是当初想要的。

String.Source: Do you plan on staying in Skyrim?
String.Dest: 你计划待在天际省？

String.Source: I am reminded of the story of a carpenter who was tasked with hanging a painting for the Count.
String.Dest: 这让我想起了一个关于为伯爵挂画的木匠的故事。

String.Source: Do you plan on staying in Skyrim?
String.Dest: 你计划待在天际省？

String.Source: The Aedra are thought to be callous because they are indifferent, too often leaving mortals to their own devices.
String.Dest: 圣灵们被认为是冷酷无情的，因为他们常常把凡人留在困境中不管不顾。

String.Source: Can the Aedra be sinister?
String.Dest: 圣灵可能是邪恶的?

String.Source: It reminds me of the parable of the acolyte priestess who stole from the alms bowl.
String.Dest: 这使我想起了那个关于从神的金钵里偷东西的女祭司的寓言。

String.Source: Can the Aedra be sinister?
String.Dest: 圣灵可能是邪恶的?

String.Source: The other acolytes beseeched the head priest to investigate the matter and cast the thief out.
String.Dest: 其他的僧侣恳求祭司长调查偷窃事件并抓出窃贼。

String.Source: Can the Aedra be sinister?
String.Dest: 圣灵可能是邪恶的?

String.Source: Yet the priest replied that he already knew the identity of the thief. The acolytes, angered, threatened to leave if the culprit was not revealed.
String.Dest: 然而祭司长却回答说他已经知道了窃贼的身份。其他的僧侣非常生气，他们威胁道，如果不揭穿小偷的身份，他们就要全部离开这里。

String.Source: Can the Aedra be sinister?
String.Dest: 圣灵可能是邪恶的?

String.Source: If I cast the thief out, he replied, how will he ever learn remorse? If you leave, how will I ever teach you forgiveness?
String.Dest: 如果我指出了那名窃贼，祭司长说，他怎么能学会自责呢？如果你都离开了，我能么能教会你宽恕呢？

String.Source: Can the Aedra be sinister?
String.Dest: 圣灵可能是邪恶的?

String.Source: I see. That very greed consumed Ancano, just as the Augur foretold. Yet perhaps greed is what motivated you to conquer him.
String.Dest: 我懂了。安卡诺的贪婪欲望已经无法控制，正如预言师杜兰所言。然而，或许贪婪正是你打败他的契机。

String.Source: I would have killed them myself to become Arch-Mage.
String.Dest: 为了成为首席法师，我会亲手杀了他们的.

String.Source: Thus, when your power becomes out of control, another will appear. You will live in fear, but that is also a good thing.
String.Dest: 因此，当你的力量失控之时，另一个会出现。你会生活在恐惧之中，但这也是件好事儿。

String.Source: I would have killed them myself to become Arch-Mage.
String.Dest: 为了成为首席法师，我会亲手杀了他们的.

String.Source: To live without fear is to live according to the parable of the Elf. I can tell you the story, if you are inclined to hear it.
String.Dest: 想要过没有恐惧的生活就要遵守精灵的预言。我可以给你讲述这些故事，如果你很想听的话。

String.Source: I would have killed them myself to become Arch-Mage.
String.Dest: 为了成为首席法师，我会亲手杀了他们的.

String.Source: Indeed. I pray Namira will consume them, and Arkay will guide them to Aetherius. We shall mourn, but we should not be sad.
String.Dest: 确实如此。我祈祷娜米拉把他们吃掉，而阿尔凯引导他们的灵魂去往艾瑟瑞斯。我们可以悼念，但没必要悲伤。

String.Source: Yes. Incredibly bittersweet. Blessings of the Divines to both of them.
String.Dest: 是啊，真是苦乐参半啊。愿圣灵保佑他们两个。

String.Source: Such is the cycle of death and life. It reminds me of a parable, if you wish to hear it.
String.Dest: 这是生和死的一个轮回。它让我想起了一个寓言，如果你想听的话。

String.Source: Yes. Incredibly bittersweet. Blessings of the Divines to both of them.
String.Dest: 是啊，真是苦乐参半啊。愿圣灵保佑他们两个。

String.Source: There is a saying that mortals have. It is not a parable, but it has wisdom all the same. They say "It is better to be lucky than good."
String.Dest: 凡人们有句谚语。虽然通俗但依旧智慧。他们说：“好运胜过实力。”

String.Source: It was all luck. I'm no hero. I'm a fraud.
String.Dest: 那都是侥幸。我不是英雄，我是个骗子。

String.Source: Many good warriors die in battle. Many great heroes, mages, and thieves are vanquished by the forces of evil.
String.Dest: 很多优秀的战士战死沙场。很多伟大的英雄、法师、盗贼被邪恶的力量所征服。

String.Source: It was all luck. I'm no hero. I'm a fraud.
String.Dest: 那都是侥幸。我不是英雄，我是个骗子。

String.Source: However, no one has ever called a dead man lucky. No one has ever said that the defeated are fortunate.
String.Dest: 然而，从未有一个人夸死人是幸运的。也没有一个人说失败是幸运的。

String.Source: It was all luck. I'm no hero. I'm a fraud.
String.Dest: 那都是侥幸。我不是英雄，我是个骗子。

String.Source: Pray to Nocturnal and thank her for her blessing. She has brought you many spoils, and to deny them would be an insult she would not take kindly.
String.Dest: 向诺克图娜尔祈祷并感谢她的赐福。她会给你带来了许多战利品，而如果拒绝它们的话，诺克图娜尔会将这视为一种无法接受的侮辱。

String.Source: It was all luck. I'm no hero. I'm a fraud.
String.Dest: 那都是侥幸。我不是英雄，我是个骗子。

String.Source: It is not a tale that has an ending, so yours is as valid as any. Yet you cannot say that the thief took everything.
String.Dest: 这个故事并没有结尾，所以你可以尽情想像它的结局。但是你不能说这个贼偷走了所有东西。

String.Source: And that's how a dumb priest lost everything to a single thief.
String.Dest: 这就是一个愚蠢的牧师如何被一个小偷偷走所有东西的故事。

String.Source: For one cannot steal wisdom, and the words imparted by the priest were meant not only for the thief, but the ears of his acolytes.
String.Dest: 因为人不能偷走智慧，并且这名祭司长的话不仅仅对这个贼有意义，还有那些接受了他智慧的修道士们。

String.Source: And that's how a dumb priest lost everything to a single thief.
String.Dest: 这就是一个愚蠢的牧师如何被一个小偷偷走所有东西的故事。

String.Source: It was placed on the top of a high bookshelf. Now they say those who hurry only slow themselves in the end. If only I heeded such sage advice.
String.Dest: 它被放在一个高书架的顶部。他们说欲速则不达。真希望我听从了这样的忠告。

String.Source: Where did you find it?
String.Dest: 你在哪儿找到的？

String.Source: Instead of reaching for the footstool, I attempted to climb the shelf, only to fall flat on my tail.
String.Dest: 我没去找凳子，而是试着坐上了架子，这样我的尾巴才好放。

String.Source: Where did you find it?
String.Dest: 你在哪儿找到的？

String.Source: However, as it so happens, I lost my balance but gained my footing. For when my head struck the ground, I had a vision.
String.Dest: 然而，就是那么凑巧啊，我失去了平衡且摔在地面。因头着地而头晕目眩。

String.Source: Where did you find it?
String.Dest: 你在哪儿找到的？

String.Source: I was trained as priest of Stendarr, but I felt the Temple did not do enough to disavow the militants who walk the land in his name.
String.Dest: 我受训成为一名斯丹达尔祭司，但是我感觉这座神庙做得还不够，没有否认那些以它之名四处奔走的激进分子。

String.Source: How did you come to adopt this philosophy?
String.Dest: 你是怎样形成这种的理念的呢？

String.Source: I considered converting to the Temple of Julianos, and had packed for the great chapel in Skingrad to begin my training.
String.Dest: 我打算转到尤里安诺思的神庙，并收拾行李到斯金格勒的大教堂开始我的训练。

String.Source: How did you come to adopt this philosophy?
String.Dest: 你是怎样形成这种的理念的呢？

String.Source: There was only one item I could not find, my copy of the book "Aedra and Daedra." I scoured every corner of my quarters, until at last I saw it.
String.Dest: 但是有一样东西我始终找不到了，是我手抄的“圣灵与魔神”这本书。我找遍了住所里所有的角落，直到最后我终于看到了它。

String.Source: How did you come to adopt this philosophy?
String.Dest: 你是怎样形成这种的理念的呢？

String.Source: Possession of a thing can change, just as often as a piece of coin. This applies to the Reach, as well as the banner of justice.
String.Dest: 什么东西的价值都是变动的，就像物价一样波动。在瑞驰也是这样，在正义的旗帜下也一样。

String.Source: The Reach belongs to the Forsworn. I chose the side of justice.
String.Dest: The Reach belongs to the Forsworn. I chose the side of justice.

String.Source: Yet only time will tell whether our actions have shifted the balance. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 然而，只有时间才能告诉我们，我们的行动是否扭转了形势。如果你愿意听的话，我想起了一个寓言。

String.Source: The Reach belongs to the Forsworn. I chose the side of justice.
String.Dest: The Reach belongs to the Forsworn. I chose the side of justice.

String.Source: Possession of a thing can change, just as often as a piece of coin. This applies to the Reach, as well as the banner of justice.
String.Dest: 什么东西的价值都是变动的，就像物价一样波动。在瑞驰也是这样，在正义的旗帜下也一样。

String.Source: The Forsworn have no justifiable claim on this land. They are bandits.
String.Dest: The Forsworn have no justifiable claim on this land. They are bandits.

String.Source: Yet only time will tell whether our actions have shifted the balance. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 然而，只有时间才能告诉我们，我们的行动是否扭转了形势。如果你愿意听的话，我想起了一个寓言。

String.Source: The Forsworn have no justifiable claim on this land. They are bandits.
String.Dest: The Forsworn have no justifiable claim on this land. They are bandits.

String.Source: I suspected as much. You know very well that I view the world from such a prism, with all things balanced, all things reliant on each other.
String.Dest: 我有些怀疑。你清楚的知道我从一个棱镜中观察这个世界，万物和谐，相互依靠的世界。

String.Source: Both. Meditation helps develop magical skill, philosophy ensures it proper use.
String.Dest: 两者都有。冥想有助于提升魔法技能，人生观确保它正确的适用。

String.Source: Thus the Elder Way is about developing magic, as much as it is hindering its use.
String.Dest: 因此这个古老的方法既发展了魔法也同时阻碍了它的使用。

String.Source: Both. Meditation helps develop magical skill, philosophy ensures it proper use.
String.Dest: 两者都有。冥想有助于提升魔法技能，人生观确保它正确的适用。

String.Source: I had feared, however, that my biases would fog my mind and prevent me from seeing any other answer. I thank you for alleviating me of my concerns.
String.Dest: 我曾恐惧,不管怎样，那是偏见蒙蔽了我.谢谢你减轻了我的忧虑.

String.Source: Both. Meditation helps develop magical skill, philosophy ensures it proper use.
String.Dest: 两者都有。冥想有助于提升魔法技能，人生观确保它正确的适用。

String.Source: It was a hard fall, yes, but I assure you, my mind has never been so clear.
String.Dest: 这是一个艰难的秋天，但我向你保证，我的内心从来没有如此的明朗。

String.Source: You can't trust Hircine. You'd agree if you didn't fall and bang your head.
String.Dest: 你不能信任海尔辛。如果你没有摔倒并撞到你的头颅的话，你会同意的。

String.Source: Consider, for instance, the difference between a domesticated hound and a feral dog.
String.Dest: 考虑一下吧，举个例子，这就像是一只被驯化的猎犬和一只凶猛的狗之间的区别。

String.Source: You can't trust Hircine. You'd agree if you didn't fall and bang your head.
String.Dest: 你不能信任海尔辛。如果你没有摔倒并撞到你的头颅的话，你会同意的。

String.Source: One is free to hunt, but if he fails he will starve. The other never hungers, but roams only where his master commands.
String.Dest: 一种人弄能够自由狩猎，但是如果他失败了他就得挨饿。其另一种人永远不会挨饿，但是只能在他的主人划分的区域下走动。

String.Source: You can't trust Hircine. You'd agree if you didn't fall and bang your head.
String.Dest: 你不能信任海尔辛。如果你没有摔倒并撞到你的头颅的话，你会同意的。

String.Source: Both are free, and yet neither can act freely. In life and in death, there is no perfect choice. There is only what is right for yourself.
String.Dest: 你俩都是自由的，但都不能自由行动。在生死之间，没有完美的选项。只有适合自己的选项。

String.Source: You can't trust Hircine. You'd agree if you didn't fall and bang your head.
String.Dest: 你不能信任海尔辛。如果你没有摔倒并撞到你的头颅的话，你会同意的。

String.Source: Ah, a warrior once told me that wisdom was a poor substitute for a good mace. But a tool only becomes a weapon when one knows how to wield it.
String.Dest: 啊，一名战士曾告诉我，以智慧来代替一柄好用的狼牙棒可不是一个好主意。但一样工具，只有使用的人懂得如何运用，它才会变成武器。

String.Source: Your advice is amusing, but it won't help me slay a dragon. Better you stay.
String.Dest: 你的建议很有趣，不过对屠龙的事情帮不上忙。所以还是老实呆着吧。

String.Source: However, I trust you do not suffer from such deficiencies. It is I who has learned much from our experiences together.
String.Dest: 然而，我相信你并不会受这些问题困扰。与你同行的经历让我获益良多。

String.Source: Your advice is amusing, but it won't help me slay a dragon. Better you stay.
String.Dest: 你的建议很有趣，不过对屠龙的事情帮不上忙。所以还是老实呆着吧。

String.Source: It is my regret that I cannot follow you to the end. Yet, while this path is meant to be walked by a single person, it will not walked be alone.
String.Dest: 我很抱歉不能跟你一路走到最后。但是，虽然得你一个人走，可你并不是一个人。

String.Source: Your advice is amusing, but it won't help me slay a dragon. Better you stay.
String.Dest: 你的建议很有趣，不过对屠龙的事情帮不上忙。所以还是老实呆着吧。

String.Source: All of Nirn, and all the Gods, Aedra and Daedra, walk in harmony with your steps. As do I.
String.Dest: 奈恩的所有生物, 以及所有的众神，神族和魔族, 都与你的步伐一致。我也一样。

String.Source: Your advice is amusing, but it won't help me slay a dragon. Better you stay.
String.Dest: 你的建议很有趣，不过对屠龙的事情帮不上忙。所以还是老实呆着吧。

String.Source: If you seek Nocturnal's favor, that is not the way. Clutch the bird too tightly, and it will suffocate. Clutch it too lightly, and it will fly away.
String.Dest: 如果你在寻求诺克图娜尔的帮助，那你的方式错了。就像将小鸟抓在掌心一样，如果你握得太紧，它就会窒息，而如果你握得太松，那它就会飞走。

String.Source: Well, I plan on worshipping her forever whether she likes it or not.
String.Dest: 反正我这辈子就拜她了，管她愿不愿意。

String.Source: It is difficult to choose. The other monks preferred the salmon, as did I, when all we did was salt the fish.
String.Dest: 这很难去选。当我们之中只有腌鱼的时候，其他修道士却更喜欢大马哈鱼，我也一样。

String.Source: What sort of fish do you like best?
String.Dest: 你最喜欢什么样的鱼？

String.Source: Yet in my travels across Tamriel, I tasted a longfin seared with onions, parsley, fresh garlic, and a squeeze of lemon, and I thought that was best.
String.Dest: 但在我游历泰姆瑞尔大陆过程中，我尝过用洋葱，香菜，新鲜大蒜来搭配，并挤了点柠檬汁的长鳍鱼。我认为这么吃是最好的。

String.Source: What sort of fish do you like best?
String.Dest: 你最喜欢什么样的鱼？

String.Source: And so on and so forth, from raw to cooked, from the River Betty to the tuna and back to the salmon. So, I will say the best is yet to come.
String.Dest: 诸如此类，从生肉到熟食，从Betty河到金枪鱼，或者鲑鱼。所以，我觉得最好的美味总是需要等待。

String.Source: What sort of fish do you like best?
String.Dest: 你最喜欢什么样的鱼？

String.Source: Yes, and you are now prior of this monastery, a steward of magical knowledge. You are the Arch-Mage.
String.Dest: 是的，你现在是修道院的先驱，魔法知识的管理者。你是首席法师。

String.Source: The College is safe, Ancano is dead, and the Eye is contained.
String.Dest: 冬堡学院安全了, 虽然安卡诺死去了, 但是Eye被控制住了.

String.Source: When one is awarded such a position, it is often bittersweet, for it comes at the resignation of another.
String.Dest: 当一个人被授予了这样一个职位，那么这常常是苦乐参半的，因为这来源于另一位的辞退。

String.Source: The College is safe, Ancano is dead, and the Eye is contained.
String.Dest: 冬堡学院安全了, 虽然安卡诺死去了, 但是Eye被控制住了.

String.Source: Yet such is the natural order of things. Seasons turn, the old wither and die, and as Namira rots, Arkay gives way to new beginnings.
String.Dest: 然而这就是自然的法则。四季转换，生物枯萎，死去，就像是娜米拉的腐朽，阿尔凯则给了我们一个新的开始。

String.Source: The College is safe, Ancano is dead, and the Eye is contained.
String.Dest: 冬堡学院安全了, 虽然安卡诺死去了, 但是Eye被控制住了.

String.Source: I am reminded of the story of a chef who was summoned at the last minute to prepare a meal for his Jarl.
String.Dest: 我想起了一个关于一个匆匆被领主唤去准备餐点的厨师的故事。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: Pressed for time, he scurried to the garden and lopped off the tops from a patch of scallions and chives.
String.Dest: 由于时间紧迫，他匆忙地跑进菜园割一些葱和韭菜。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: Unbeknownst to the chef, there was a green serpent amongst the vegetables, which he chopped and threw into the soup.
String.Dest: 厨师并不知道的是，有一条绿色的小蛇就盘伏在那些他扔进汤里的蔬菜中间。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: He had just realized his error when the Jarl and his housecarls entered the kitchen and greeted the chef.
String.Dest: 当领主和他的侍卫来到厨房视察的时候，厨师才意识到自己犯的错误。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: The Jarl was eager to try the chef's soup and quickly clutched the ladle, in spite of the chef's humble protest.
String.Dest: 领主迫不及待地想要尝尝厨师做的汤，他抓起了汤匙并忽略了厨师低声下气的反对。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: The chef cringed as the Jarl brought the soup to his lips, kissing the snake head as it floated to the surface.
String.Dest: 领主将汤放到了嘴边，他的唇已经接触到了那条浮在汤表面的蛇头。厨师吓得畏缩了起来。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: Yet the Jarl beamed. It was the most delicious soup he had ever tasted.
String.Dest: 然而领主却是满脸笑容，他表示这是他尝过的最好喝的汤。

String.Source: Actually, those are the Daedra I like.
String.Dest: 其实，这些都是我喜欢的魔族。

String.Source: An adventurer treads through a cave, when he is attacked by trolls. He runs toward a ledge, and attempts to descend down a vine of hanging moss.
String.Dest: 一名冒险者被一只巨魔袭击了，他不得不跑进一个洞穴。他跑向一块岩石突出的边缘，抓着悬苔的藤蔓试图降到下面去。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: It is then that he discovers a pack of wolves at the bottom, waiting hungrily for his arrival. Only the moss sustains him.
String.Dest: 然而他发现下面还有一群饿狼正饥肠辘辘地等着他下来。这时只有藤蔓支撑着他。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: If he waits, he knows that help may arrive. The cave is frequented by warriors and adventurers alike.
String.Dest: 如果他等在那里，他知道也许救援会来。这个山洞好像经常有战士和冒险者出没。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: It is then that he notices the dagger lodged in the rock beside him.
String.Dest: 就在那时他发现他身后的石头上有一把匕首。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: It is just beyond his reach, but he thinks he can lunge for it, if he lets go of the moss.
String.Dest: 那把匕首正巧比他能触及的范围远了一点点，但是他觉得他放开藤蔓的话，他可以一跃抓到那把匕首。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: A wealthy Jarl requests a bard to craft him a verse for his children. The verse must convey his desire for their happiness.
String.Dest: 一名富有的领主要求一个吟游诗人为他的孩子们作一首诗，诗里要包含领主对他孩子们幸福的祝愿。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: The bard meditates on the subject, before returning with his verse. He stands before the Jarl and recites the following:
String.Dest: 诗人思考了一会，然后就开始吟唱。他站在领主面前唱出了如下诗句：

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: May your children know anguish, pain, and suffering. May they know boredom and strife, fear and despair.
String.Dest: May your children know anguish, pain, and suffering. May they know boredom and strife, fear and despair.

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: The Jarl leaps angrily from his throne, and demands the bard explain this insult.
String.Dest: 领主听了之后，气得从他的宝座上跳了起来，然后要求诗人解释他刚才的无礼。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: The bard deftly replies, "Forgive me, my Jarl. You asked me to write a verse that conveys the spirit of true happiness."
String.Dest: 诗人巧妙地答道：“请原谅我，我的领主。您刚才要求我写一首承载着真正幸福精神的诗歌”

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: I believe I have fulfilled that request. For without knowledge of pain and sadness, one cannot truly know what it means to be happy.
String.Dest: I believe I have fulfilled that request. For without knowledge of pain and sadness, one cannot truly know what it means to be happy.

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: The ambitious young swordsman visited the Hall of the Companions, in hopes of becoming a great warrior.
String.Dest: 一个抱着成为一个伟大勇士梦想的富有野心的剑士来到了战友团。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: Upon meeting the Harbinger, the swordsman asked, "If I start now, how long before I can become a Companion?"
String.Dest: 当面见先驱的时候，那位剑士问道，"如果从现在开始算的话，我要多久才能成为战友团的一员呢？"

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: The Harbinger stroked his gray beard and replied, "10 years." The swordsman could not wait that long. "What if I trained every day?" he asked.
String.Dest: 先驱抚摸着他灰色的胡子然后说道，“10年。” 这个剑客等不了那么久。“如果我每天都训练呢？”他问。

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: 5 years, then, the Harbinger replied. To that the swordsman inquired, "Well, what if I train day and night?"
String.Dest: 5 years, then, the Harbinger replied. To that the swordsman inquired, "Well, what if I train day and night?"

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: 20 years then, the Harbinger said, his face stretching into a yawn. "That makes no sense," the swordsman answered.
String.Dest: 20 years then, the Harbinger said, his face stretching into a yawn. "That makes no sense," the swordsman answered.

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: The Harbinger looked him in the eye and cracked a wry smile. "Oh, it makes sense," he said, "for you see, those who hurry are slow to learn."
String.Dest: 先驱看着他的眼睛并露出一个苦笑。“哦，那很有意义，”他说“正像你看见的，那些急于求成的人反而学不到东西。”

String.Source: Tell me a parable, monk.
String.Dest: 给我讲个寓言吧，僧侣。

String.Source: And I am eager to see what the winds of change have in store for Markarth. The result will likely not be as either Madanach or the Jarl intends.
String.Dest: 而我渴望看到变革之风为马卡斯城带来的是什么。结果或许会超出迈德纳奇亦或是领主的计划。

String.Source: I prefer chaos. Let the Forsworn wreak havoc upon the Reach.
String.Dest: I prefer chaos. Let the Forsworn wreak havoc upon the Reach.

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 不过只有时间才能证明我们所做之事的真正效果。我想起一个寓言，不知你有没有兴趣听。

String.Source: I prefer chaos. Let the Forsworn wreak havoc upon the Reach.
String.Dest: I prefer chaos. Let the Forsworn wreak havoc upon the Reach.

String.Source: And you have dealt a great blow, cutting the head off the snake. Or it could be the Forsworn are like a worm, and each cut serves only to multiply.
String.Dest: 你下手还真重，直接把那条蛇的脑袋给砍下来了。不过说不定弃誓者都跟蚯蚓一样，对半砍断了还能直接变出两只来。

String.Source: The Forsworn are a blight on the Reach and had to be disposed.
String.Dest: 那些弃誓者完全是瑞驰上的毒瘤，越早消灭越好！

String.Source: The Forsworn are a blight on the Reach and had to be disposed.
String.Dest: 那些弃誓者完全是瑞驰上的毒瘤，越早消灭越好！

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effects of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 到这一步，只有时间会证明我们行动的影响了……我想到一个寓言，要听么？

String.Source: Why in Oblivion are you asking me? I just smash things.
String.Dest: 你干毛要问我呢？我只是打杂的。

String.Source: True, which is why I value your counsel most of all. If are minds were similar, we would undoubtedly come to the same conclusion.
String.Dest: 没错，这就是我给你忠告的最主要原因。如果我们的思想彼此类似，那么毫无疑问，我们会得出一致的结论。

String.Source: Why in Oblivion are you asking me? I just smash things.
String.Dest: 你干毛要问我呢？我只是打杂的。

String.Source: Without an opposing viewpoint, I would not be forced to defend or reconsider my position, thus weakening its argument.
String.Dest: 没有反方观点的话，我就没法据理力争或是重新考量己方观点，也就不能发起辩论。

String.Source: Why in Oblivion are you asking me? I just smash things.
String.Dest: 你干毛要问我呢？我只是打杂的。

String.Source: But it seems this topic does not interest you in the slightest. Very well, perhaps there will be other things we can discuss later.
String.Dest: 但你似乎对这个话题一点也提不起兴趣。好吧,也许我们一会儿可以讨论些其他事情。

String.Source: True. I would go mad if I had to live in a mead hall for the rest of my life.
String.Dest: 没错，如果让我在蜂蜜酒地度过余生我会发疯的。

String.Source: So it is safe to say that you have no desire to spend eternity in Sovngarde. But is it the Hunting Grounds of Hircine you seek?
String.Dest: 那么说你对去松加德成就永生没什么兴趣准没错。或许海尔辛的狩猎场才是你所追寻的地方？

String.Source: True. I would go mad if I had to live in a mead hall for the rest of my life.
String.Dest: 没错，如果让我在蜂蜜酒地度过余生我会发疯的。

String.Source: One with your destiny can choose from many paths, but in the end, there is no clear solution.
String.Dest: 你的一支命运能通过许多方式达到到，但最终，并没有明确的方式。

String.Source: True. I would go mad if I had to live in a mead hall for the rest of my life.
String.Dest: 没错，如果让我在蜂蜜酒地度过余生我会发疯的。

String.Source: This is the fate of mortals in life and in death. We must make decisions based on incomplete information, from a group of imperfect choices.
String.Dest: 对于凡人来说，生死自有命。我们的从那些信息不完整的选择中做出决定。

String.Source: I'm thankful to have had your wisdom through this journey.
String.Dest: 这一路上有你的智慧相陪伴，我非常感激。

String.Source: And yet, the wisdom I have imparted is but a fraction of what I have learned through the experiences we have shared.
String.Dest: 然而，我所被赋予的智慧只是从我们所分享的经验中所学到的东西中的一小部分。

String.Source: I'm thankful to have had your wisdom through this journey.
String.Dest: 这一路上有你的智慧相陪伴，我非常感激。

String.Source: I hope to weave your story into a new parable, for even the plight of a great hero may echo the struggles of all mortals.
String.Dest: 我期望把你的故事编制入一个新的寓言中，因为一个伟大的英雄的困境会折射出所有凡人的挣扎。

String.Source: I'm thankful to have had your wisdom through this journey.
String.Dest: 这一路上有你的智慧相陪伴，我非常感激。

String.Source: Thus it is my regret that I cannot follow you to the end. Yet, while this path is meant to be walked by a single person, it will not walked be alone.
String.Dest: 因此我很抱歉不能陪你走到最后。虽然这条路注定只能一人前进，但你不会是一个人孤零零的上路。

String.Source: I'm thankful to have had your wisdom through this journey.
String.Dest: 这一路上有你的智慧相陪伴，我非常感激。

String.Source: All of Nirn, and all the Gods, Aedra and Daedra, walk in harmony with your steps. As do I.
String.Dest: 奈恩的所有生物, 以及所有的众神，神族和魔族, 都与你的步伐一致。我也一样。

String.Source: Sounds like she's just lazy to me.
String.Dest: 听起来她只是对我厌倦了。

String.Source: (Laughs) If I were you, I would not say that in front of her. The capricious are also known to be vindictive.
String.Dest: (笑)我要是你，就绝不会在他面前说那样的话。那种任性通常也是很有报复心的呢。

String.Source: It's probably because you're a cat. Cats like fish. It is known.
String.Dest: 很可能因为你是猫，猫喜欢鱼，众所周知。

String.Source: I do not think so. The Khajiit are desert people, Dragonborn, and there are very few fish that swim through sand.
String.Dest: 我不这样认为。虎人是荒漠的人，龙裔, 在沙子中游过的鱼屈指可数。

String.Source: It's probably because you're a cat. Cats like fish. It is known.
String.Dest: 很可能因为你是猫，猫喜欢鱼，众所周知。

String.Source: Many, of course, prefer a different kind of fishing altogether, but Stendarr willed that I take a less traditional path.
String.Dest: 许多人肯定会更喜欢一种另类的方法来捕鱼，但是斯丹纳尔却坚持认为我很少走传统的路。

String.Source: I pay homage to the Divines as a whole, and the invisible thread that is woven between them.
String.Dest: 整体来说，我对神灵还有那些交织在他们中间的无形的线表达敬意。

String.Source: So you worship all Aedra and Daedra?
String.Dest: 所以你信仰着所有的圣灵跟魔族？

String.Source: One does not look at a centipede and see fifteen separate segments. One cannot focus on a leaf, for in doing so he will neglect the whole tree.
String.Dest: 某人看见一只蜈蚣时，看到的不会是十五个彼此独立的片段。同样也不会把全部注意力仅仅集中在一片叶子上，因为那样他将会忽略整棵树。

String.Source: So you worship all Aedra and Daedra?
String.Dest: 所以你信仰着所有的圣灵跟魔族？

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: I wish to thank you. You are what the blacksmiths call a touchstone. A standard bearer for all mortals.
String.Dest: 我想谢谢你。你就是铁匠们所谓的“试金石”。一个供世人参照的楷模。

String.Source: Fine. Say what you want to say.
String.Dest: 好吧，想说什么就说吧。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: For time and time again you have sacrificed your life so that we may live.
String.Dest: 你一次又一次，不惜性命拯救我们。

String.Source: Fine. Say what you want to say.
String.Dest: 好吧，想说什么就说吧。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: Now, I am not one who loathes dragons, for the fly cannot begrudge the spider for spinning its web.
String.Dest: 现在，我不再是那些讨厌龙的人之一了，苍蝇不能因为蜘蛛结网就嫉妒它。

String.Source: Fine. Say what you want to say.
String.Dest: 好吧，想说什么就说吧。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: However, unlike the dragons of the wild, Alduin did not live in harmony with this world, for the world itself was his prey.
String.Dest: 然而，跟其他的龙不一样，奥杜因不可能同这个世界和谐共处。因为世界本身就是他的猎物。

String.Source: Fine. Say what you want to say.
String.Dest: 好吧，想说什么就说吧。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: It was either him or us. And as a member of the mortal race, I am glad that you were on our side.
String.Dest: 不是他就是我们。作为人类的一员，我很高兴你在我们这边。

String.Source: Fine. Say what you want to say.
String.Dest: 好吧，想说什么就说吧。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: I wish to thank you. You are what the blacksmiths call a touchstone. A standard bearer for all mortals.
String.Dest: 我想谢谢你。你就是铁匠们所谓的“试金石”。一个供世人参照的楷模。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: For time and time again you have sacrificed your life so that we may live.
String.Dest: 你一次又一次，不惜性命拯救我们。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: Now, I am not one who loathes dragons, for the fly cannot begrudge the spider for spinning its web.
String.Dest: 现在，我不再是那些讨厌龙的人之一了，苍蝇不能因为蜘蛛结网就嫉妒它。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: However, unlike the dragons of the wild, Alduin did not live in harmony with this world, for the world itself was his prey.
String.Dest: 然而，跟其他的龙不一样，奥杜因不可能同这个世界和谐共处。因为世界本身就是他的猎物。

String.Source: Very well. I'd be honored to hear your words.
String.Dest: 太好了！我将十分荣幸听您讲话！

String.Source: It was either him or us. And as a member of the mortal race, I am glad that you were on our side.
String.Dest: 不是他就是我们。作为人类的一员，我很高兴你在我们这边。

String.Source: Ah, you have returned victorious. I suspect I should provide you with a parable to commemorate your triumph.
String.Dest: 啊，你胜利归来了。我想我应该给你撰写一则寓言，以此庆祝你的胜利。

String.Source: Alduin is no more. It's finally over.
String.Dest: 奥杜因不过如此。他最后还是被终结了。

String.Source: Yet on this occasion, I wish to offer you my own words, and to speak to you not as a monk, but as a Khajiit.
String.Dest: 但是，在这场合想, 我想送给你一句话，不是以一名修道士，而是作为一名虎人对你说。

String.Source: Alduin is no more. It's finally over.
String.Dest: 奥杜因不过如此。他最后还是被终结了。

String.Source: Thonar put me in prison. This was about revenge.
