String.Dest: Thonar put me in prison. This was about revenge.

String.Source: And still, so many things change based on a single action. Your revenge is Madanach's freedom, and Markarth's war.
String.Dest: And still, so many things change based on a single action. Your revenge is Madanach's freedom, and Markarth's war.

String.Source: Thonar put me in prison. This was about revenge.
String.Dest: Thonar put me in prison. This was about revenge.

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.

String.Source: Thonar is wealthy and I assumed he would offer the greater boon.
String.Dest: 托纳尔很富有而且我猜测他会提供更好的福利。

String.Source: He is the wealthier of the two, yes, but men like him did not build their wealth by being generous.
String.Dest: 两者中他更土豪，没错，不过这样的人可不是靠慷慨大方成为土豪的。

String.Source: Thonar is wealthy and I assumed he would offer the greater boon.
String.Dest: 托纳尔很富有而且我猜测他会提供更好的福利。

String.Source: And by choosing Thonar, Markarth will sustain its current order. Thonar will grow stronger, and one wonders what it will take to return the balance.
String.Dest: 通过托纳尔，马卡斯城得以维持其本来的秩序。然而随着托纳尔势力的强大，人们也开始担忧他所带来的势力平衡究竟会变成什么样。

String.Source: Thonar is wealthy and I assumed he would offer the greater boon.
String.Dest: 托纳尔很富有而且我猜测他会提供更好的福利。

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 不过只有时间才能证明我们所做之事的真正效果。我想起一个寓言，不知你有没有兴趣听。

String.Source: Killing both seemed to be the most rewarding solution.
String.Dest: 最好的解决方法就是把双方都给杀了。

String.Source: For both yourself and for Markarth. At times, order is like a pesky weed. It must be pulled from the root, or it will return to its original size.
String.Dest: 为了你自己，也为了马卡斯城。有时，秩序就如讨厌的杂草。斩草必除根，否则春风吹又生。

String.Source: Killing both seemed to be the most rewarding solution.
String.Dest: 最好的解决方法就是把双方都给杀了。

String.Source: Yet only time will tell the true effect of our actions. I am reminded of a parable, if you would like to hear it.
String.Dest: 不过只有时间才能证明我们所做之事的真正效果。我想起一个寓言，不知你有没有兴趣听。

String.Source: The Psijic's magic is real. I suspect the rest is philosophical troll manure.
String.Dest: 赛伊克人的魔法是真实的。我怀疑其余部分只是故弄玄虚。

String.Source: So like Vanus Galerion before you, it is your belief that the Psijic's magic can exist outside the Elder Way.
String.Dest: 正如像在你之前的万纳斯·加里兰一般，赛伊克人的魔法可以存在上古之道之外这点正是你的信仰。

String.Source: The Psijic's magic is real. I suspect the rest is philosophical troll manure.
String.Dest: 赛伊克人的魔法是真实的。我怀疑其余部分只是故弄玄虚。

String.Source: Still, one cannot say that guilds of Tamriel can compare to the power of the Psijics, despite having a larger pool of applicants.
String.Dest: 然而，尽管它们有更多的申请者，我们仍不能说泰姆瑞尔的公会能与赛伊克的相提并论。

String.Source: The Psijic's magic is real. I suspect the rest is philosophical troll manure.
String.Dest: 赛伊克人的魔法是真实的。我怀疑其余部分只是故弄玄虚。

String.Source: I wonder if indeed this is proof that the Elder Way is in fact the true key to harnessing one's magical potential.
String.Dest: 我不知道这是否可以证明：上古之道实则是控制一个人魔法潜能的关键。

String.Source: I just want power in this life. I'll worry about the next when I'm dead.
String.Dest: 我只想在活着时拥有力量。死后会如何我很担心。

String.Source: Ah, but it is this life which determines your path to the next. The two are connected, one constantly influencing the other.
String.Dest: 哎，这就是命啊，此路未完又是一路。两路相连，总是在不停地互相影响的对方。

String.Source: I just want power in this life. I'll worry about the next when I'm dead.
String.Dest: 我只想在活着时拥有力量。死后会如何我很担心。

String.Source: For Kodlak, the anxiety of death altered his path in life. For you, your myopic view of life will determine your path in death.
String.Dest: 对于克拉科来说, 死亡的焦虑改变了他生命的轨迹。对于你来说，你人生观的短视决定你死亡的轨迹。

String.Source: I just want power in this life. I'll worry about the next when I'm dead.
String.Dest: 我只想在活着时拥有力量。死后会如何我很担心。

String.Source: After all, a wolf must serve Hircine for eternity. One can seek a cure before their death, but few among us know when that day will come.
String.Dest: 一头狼终归还是得为海尔辛服务的。他或许可以在死之前找到治疗的方法，但只有我们之中的少数人才知道死亡会在何时降临。

String.Source: Hold on. How many of these parables were about your life?
String.Dest: 稍等。你生活中有多少这样的故事啊？

String.Source: Ah, that is a good question. While I may have experienced some, they are all part of who I am.
String.Dest: 啊, 这是一个很好的问题。虽然我大概经历了一些，那些都是我的一部分。

String.Source: Hold on. How many of these parables were about your life?
String.Dest: 稍等。你生活中有多少这样的故事啊？

String.Source: For what are parables but lessons of life, experiences we all share, yet we can only learn from them when viewed from distance.
String.Dest: 寓言就是生命的课程，经验我们都有，然而只有在事情过去以后我们回顾过去时才会学到。

String.Source: Hold on. How many of these parables were about your life?
String.Dest: 稍等。你生活中有多少这样的故事啊？

String.Source: To that end, this experience you will face is one that echoes the plight of many others. So while you venture off by yourself, you do not go alone.
String.Dest: 为此， 你面临的这经历会有得到许多人的回应。所以当你独自去冒险时，你并不孤单。

String.Source: Hold on. How many of these parables were about your life?
String.Dest: 稍等。你生活中有多少这样的故事啊？

String.Source: All of Nirn, and all the Gods, Aedra and Daedra, walk in harmony with your steps. As do I.
String.Dest: 奈恩的所有生物, 以及所有的众神，神族和魔族, 都与你的步伐一致。我也一样。

String.Source: I understand. Respect the darkness, but don't depend on it.
String.Dest: 我明白了。敬畏黑暗，而不是依赖它。

String.Source: Yes, for all darkness is temporary, as ephemeral as Nocturnal's favor.
String.Dest: 是的，所有的黑暗是暂时的，就像诺克图娜尔的恩赐一样转瞬即逝。

String.Source: People recall the past fondly, but it used to be the present, and that's awful.
String.Dest: 人们老是天真地怀念过去，可过去曾经也是当下，真可怕。

String.Source: Not so, my friend. Today I was able to spend the day with the Dragonborn, as we made the journey to High Hrothgar.
String.Dest: 不是那样，我的朋友。今天我能一直和龙裔在一块儿，一同踏上前往高吼峰的旅程。

String.Source: People recall the past fondly, but it used to be the present, and that's awful.
String.Dest: 人们老是天真地怀念过去，可过去曾经也是当下，真可怕。

String.Source: It was unlike any other day that has ever been lived, and when the future comes, I will look on this day as fondly as my days as a monk, if not more.
String.Dest: 这一天和我曾经活过的每一天都不一样，而以后我也会牢牢记住这一天，至少和我做修道士的日子一样印象深刻。

String.Source: What sort of wonders?
String.Dest: 什么样的奇迹？

String.Source: There were torchbugs and luna moths, and flowers that seem to light up like candles in the shadow of the blood moon.
String.Dest: 这里有火虫和月蛾，在绯色的月光下，簇簇花朵如同阴影中的烛光点点。

String.Source: What sort of wonders?
String.Dest: 什么样的奇迹？

String.Source: As she was fearful of the dark, she did not stay. Yet by the time she made her way home, she vowed to return to the garden the next morning.
String.Dest: 因为她怕黑，所以没留下。但她回家的时候承诺说第二天早上会回花园的。

String.Source: What sort of wonders?
String.Dest: 什么样的奇迹？

String.Source: Only when she did, she was ultimately disappointed. For while her fears were washed away by the light, so too was the mystery.
String.Dest: 只有当她试过了，她才会失望。虽然她的恐惧和神秘感也一同被光明洗去了。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: When the four were at dinner, he slipped a vial of frenzy poison into his drink, just enough to make the second pupil irritable.
String.Dest: 当四个人吃晚饭时，他悄悄把一小瓶狂乱药剂倒进酒里，剂量刚好够让第二个徒弟发疯。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: That night, when they returned to the shrine to meditate, the first pupil stepped on the second's foot. "Watch it!" he screamed in anger.
String.Dest: 那天晚上，当他们回到祭坛冥想的时候，打头的学生踩到了第二个学生的脚。“小心点儿！”他生气的喊道。

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: The third pupil, shocked the second had broken his vow, said "Hush! We are not supposed to talk!"
String.Dest: 第三个学生，因第二个学生打破了他的誓言而震惊，“嘘！我们不应该说话的！”

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: The first pupil, who was dear friends with the third, exclaimed "No! Why did you speak? It was only supposed to be him!"
String.Dest: 第一个学生，是第三个学生的密友，他高声喊道：“不！为什么你要这么说？唯一的可能是他！”

String.Source: What did he do?
String.Dest: 他做了什么？

String.Source: And the fourth pupil, watching them, shook his head and said, "All three of you are fools. I am the only one who has yet to break his vow."
String.Dest: 而第四个学生,看着他们, 摇着他的头说, "你们三个都是傻瓜。我就是那个打破誓言的人"

String.Source: Alright. Let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听吧。

String.Source: Four pupils visited the Temple of Julianos, in hopes of learning the essence of wisdom.
String.Dest: 四个学徒拜访了尤里安诺思神庙，希望学到智慧的真谛。

String.Source: Alright. Let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听吧。

String.Source: The Priest suggested they take a vow of silence, so that they may learn to listen rather than speak.
String.Dest: 那个牧师建议他们发誓“默言”，这样他们就会更加懂得倾听而不只会叽里呱啦地讲了。

String.Source: Alright. Let's hear it.
String.Dest: 好吧，让我们听听吧。

String.Source: The first pupil, however, did not like the second one, and made it his mission to ensure he would be the first to break.
String.Dest: 然而，第一个学生不喜欢第二个学生，并把确保第一个取得突破当成了他的使命.

String.Source: Nocturnal. Does she remind you of a parable?
String.Dest: 诺克图娜尔，她有没有让你回想起一个寓言？

String.Source: Yes. As Nocturnal is the Goddess of the Dark, I am reminded of the story of the young child who wandered too far from home.
String.Dest: 是的。提起诺克图娜尔——黑暗女神，我就想起了那个游走得离家太远的孩子的故事。

String.Source: Nocturnal. Does she remind you of a parable?
String.Dest: 诺克图娜尔，她有没有让你回想起一个寓言？

String.Source: Lost and alone, the child followed the northern star, knowing it would guide her back to the village by the shore.
String.Dest: 迷失和孤独，孩子跟着北斗星，知道它能引导她回到村里。

String.Source: Nocturnal. Does she remind you of a parable?
String.Dest: 诺克图娜尔，她有没有让你回想起一个寓言？

String.Source: Yet on the way, she found herself in a peculiar garden. Suddenly, all around her were tiny wonders.
String.Dest: 然而，在路上，她发现身处于一个奇怪的花园中。忽然之间，她四周都充满着微小的奇迹。

String.Source: Wait. So the doctrine you follow is based on a head injury?
String.Dest: 等等，你所遵守的信条该不会是在你撞坏了脑子的时候制定出来的吧？

String.Source: It was an act of the Divines. As was the placement of the book, and the title of the book itself.
String.Dest: 那是圣灵的行为。就如同那本书放置的场所，还有它本身的标题。

String.Source: Wait. So the doctrine you follow is based on a head injury?
String.Dest: 等等，你所遵守的信条该不会是在你撞坏了脑子的时候制定出来的吧？

String.Source: In my vision I saw a constellation of Gods. Aedra and Daedra. They made no distinction between themselves. For one were all, and all were one.
String.Dest: 在眼前，我看到了星座上的神灵们。他们之间并没有什么区别。一就是万物，万物是一。

String.Source: What did the Khajiit say?
String.Dest: 那个虎人说了什么？

String.Source: The Khajiit was confused. "It is not something I can just show you," he said. The priest replied, "Then it is not your true nature."
String.Dest: 那个虎人被搞糊涂了。他说“这不是能直接展现给你看的东西”。祭司回答说，“那这就不是你的天性使然。”

String.Source: What did the Khajiit say?
String.Dest: 那个虎人说了什么？

String.Source: And so I learned a valuable lesson that day. I learned my actions were a choice, and I alone was responsible for the consequences.
String.Dest: 所以那天我学到了宝贵的一课。我明白了我的行为是一个选择,而我得为自己的选择承担后果。

String.Source: What did the Khajiit say?
String.Dest: 那个虎人说了什么？

String.Source: From that day on I vowed to always make the right choices, to always walk on level sands.
String.Dest: 从那天起，我就发誓要一直做出正确的选择，这样才能一直行走在沙地之上。

String.Source: What did the Khajiit say?
String.Dest: 那个虎人说了什么？

String.Source: And yet in all my years, I have never made a finer choice than the day I decided to follow your path.
String.Dest: 我至今仍然觉得，当初决定跟随你是我这辈子做的最出色的决定。

String.Source: What did the Khajiit say?
String.Dest: 那个虎人说了什么？

String.Source: It has been an honor, Dragonborn. I thank you for allowing me to accompany you on this journey.
String.Dest: 荣幸之至，龙裔。谢谢你允许我和你一起旅行。

String.Source: (The Forsworn Conspiracy) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (弃誓者叛乱) 貌似你在想什么事情。

String.Source: Yes, it is regarding this Forsworn Conspiracy that you have unraveled. I am curious as to why you chose Thonar over Madanach.
String.Dest: 对，你弄清楚了弃誓者叛乱的那档子事儿。我很好奇为什么你选择了托纳尔而不是迈德纳奇。

String.Source: (The Forsworn Conspiracy) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (弃誓者叛乱) 貌似你在想什么事情。

String.Source: He is the one who imprisoned you, and the order that exists in Markarth is a mirage of his making. Were you not tempted to disrupt it with chaos?
String.Dest: 他就是那个监禁你的人，还有所有出马卡斯城存在的秩序都是他所制造出的幻象。难道你不打算利用混乱破坏这一切么？

String.Source: (The Forsworn Conspiracy) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (弃誓者叛乱) 貌似你在想什么事情。

String.Source: Yes, it is regarding this Forsworn Conspiracy that you have unraveled. I am curious as to why you chose Madanach over Thonar.
String.Dest: 嗯，看来你好像解决了弃誓者叛乱这个问题。我很好奇你为什么会选迈德纳奇而不是托纳尔。

String.Source: (The Forsworn Conspiracy) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (弃誓者叛乱) 貌似你在想什么事情。

String.Source: The temptation to maintain the existing order must have been great, despite it being a mirage.
String.Dest: 倾向于保持现有秩序是很好，虽然只是一厢情愿而已。

String.Source: (The Forsworn Conspiracy) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (弃誓者叛乱) 貌似你在想什么事情。

String.Source: Yes, it is regarding this Forsworn Conspiracy that you have unraveled. I am curious as to your decision regarding Madanach and Thonar.
String.Dest: 嗯，看来你好像解决了弃誓者叛乱这个问题。我很好奇你在迈德纳奇和托纳尔之间做出的选择。

String.Source: (Mages Guild Quest) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (法师公会任务) 你看起来有点心事。

String.Source: As a matter of fact, I do. It is regarding one of the text you retrieved from Fellglow Keep. The one on Artaeum.
String.Dest: 事实上,我做了。这关系到你在光落塔楼取回的一份资料。在阿泰翁岛的那份。

String.Source: (Mages Guild Quest) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (法师公会任务) 你看起来有点心事。

String.Source: It appears that, true to their name, the Psijic are monks who practice meditation and philosophy as I do, as part of their "Elder Way."
String.Dest: 它出现了，正如其名。赛伊克人都是些如我一样练习冥想以及思考哲理的修道士，是他们 "上古之道"的一部分。

String.Source: (Mages Guild Quest) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (法师公会任务) 你看起来有点心事。

String.Source: I am curious what you think of the link between developing one's magical abilities in concert with developing one's mind.
String.Dest: 我很好奇你对一个人魔法能力的提升和其思想的发展之间的联系怎么看。

String.Source: (Mages Guild Quest) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (法师公会任务) 你看起来有点心事。

String.Source: Is magic a dangerous force which requires a philosophy to control? Or is the Elder Way a means to achieving powerful magic?
String.Dest: 魔法的危险力量需要信念来控制？或是上古之道就是获得强魔力的手段？

String.Source: (Mages Guild Quest) You look like you have something on your mind.
String.Dest: (法师公会任务) 你看起来有点心事。

String.Source: Fundamentally, do you believe that one can exist without the other?
String.Dest: 从根本上说，你相信一个个体可以脱离群体独立存在吗？

String.Source: (Dragonsreach) We've done it. Odahviing will take me to Sovngarde.
String.Dest: （龙临堡）我们成功了。傲达威英会带我去松加德。

String.Source: Ah, and so the tale of our hero is coming to its climax. It reminds me of the parable of the young Khajiit who asked a priest for Stendarr's mercy.
String.Dest: 啊,然后我们英雄的传说迎来了它的巅峰。这让我想起了那个请求牧师施展斯坦达之恕的年轻虎人的寓言。

String.Source: (Dragonsreach) We've done it. Odahviing will take me to Sovngarde.
String.Dest: （龙临堡）我们成功了。傲达威英会带我去松加德。

String.Source: The Khajiit told the priest he had a terrible temper, and it thrust his body into fits of violence.
String.Dest: 这个虎人告诉祭司他脾气很坏。而且这脾气把他的身体搞得越来越适应暴力了。

String.Source: (Dragonsreach) We've done it. Odahviing will take me to Sovngarde.
String.Dest: （龙临堡）我们成功了。傲达威英会带我去松加德。

String.Source: The priest asked the young cat to demonstrate this temper, so he might see it.
String.Dest: 祭司让这只小虎猫展示下它那暴脾气给他看看，所以他大概会看到的。

String.Source: (Companions Quest) What are your thoughts on the Companions and the Circle?
String.Dest: （战友团任务）您对于同伴和圆环有什么想法么？

String.Source: I am pleased you asked. There appears to be a divide in the Hall of Jorrvaskr between those who embrace the wolf, and those who shun it.
String.Dest: 我很高兴你能提问。貌似那些信奉狼和回避狼的人在月瓦斯卡大厅中有一道分界线。

String.Source: (Companions Quest) What are your thoughts on the Companions and the Circle?
String.Dest: （战友团任务）您对于同伴和圆环有什么想法么？

String.Source: To me, this divide is merely a product of perspective. For when you see Hircine as evil, to serve him is tantamount to slavery.
String.Dest: 对我来说，这个界限就在于你是否能看的清。当你把海尔辛当做恶魔来看时，服侍他就和做他的奴隶无异。

String.Source: (Companions Quest) What are your thoughts on the Companions and the Circle?
String.Dest: （战友团任务）您对于同伴和圆环有什么想法么？

String.Source: Another might say Hircine serves his hunters, by providing them with a purpose, and an eternity of prey.
String.Dest: 别人可会说是海尔辛为他的猎人效力，为他们提供目的，和永远存在的猎物。

String.Source: (Companions Quest) What are your thoughts on the Companions and the Circle?
String.Dest: （战友团任务）您对于同伴和圆环有什么想法么？

String.Source: If Sovngarde is a mead hall of drink and festivities, I imagine someone like Aela would find it a chore.
String.Dest: 如果松加德是买醉和狂欢的酒馆，像艾拉那样的人会发现这是一个苦差事。

String.Source: (Companions Quest) What are your thoughts on the Companions and the Circle?
String.Dest: （战友团任务）您对于同伴和圆环有什么想法么？

String.Source: Such is the diversity of mortals. Sovngarde may be a utopia for some, but for others it is an Oblivion, a nightmare from which there is no escape.
String.Dest: 这就是凡人的分歧。松加德也许对一些人来说是个乐园，但对其他人来说，这里就是湮灭领域，一个无法逃脱的噩梦。

String.Source: (Thieves Guild) Is what Karliah said about Nocturnal true?
String.Dest: （盗贼公会）卡莉亚所说的诺克图娜尔的真相是什么？

String.Source: That she revels in your suffering and your success? That she is as capricious as the wind?
String.Dest: 她沉溺于你的痛苦，却又着迷于你的成功？她像风那样的反复无常吗？

String.Source: (Thieves Guild) Is what Karliah said about Nocturnal true?
String.Dest: （盗贼公会）卡莉亚所说的诺克图娜尔的真相是什么？

String.Source: Yes, it is all true, and all lies. She is a paradox. She despises those who worship her, but punishes those who neglect.
String.Dest: 是的，全是真的，又全是假的。她是矛盾的集合体。她鄙视那些崇拜她的人，却又惩罚那些怠慢她的人。

String.Source: (Thieves Guild) Is what Karliah said about Nocturnal true?
String.Dest: （盗贼公会）卡莉亚所说的诺克图娜尔的真相是什么？

String.Source: She will grant you her blessing but mock those who rely on it. Such is the mantra of the thief, and the way of the shadow.
String.Dest: 她会给你祝福，但却会嘲笑那些依赖它的人。这就是盗贼的颂歌，还有阴影之路。

String.Source: (Thieves Guild) Is what Karliah said about Nocturnal true?
String.Dest: （盗贼公会）卡莉亚所说的诺克图娜尔的真相是什么？

String.Source: And yet through the chaos there is purpose. Those who follow Nocturnal learn self-reliance, but also learn respect.
String.Dest: 然而这场混乱也是有所作用的。那些追随着诺克图娜尔的人学会了自立，也学会了尊重。

String.Source: (The Way of the Voice) Being here must bring back memories of being a monk.
String.Dest: （吼声之道）在这儿肯定能唤起你僧侣的记忆。

String.Source: Yes, it does. We did not have 7,000 steps mind you, but the monastery was perched high.
String.Dest: 对，我们还没有到7000步呢，但修道院就在那么高的地方。

String.Source: (The Way of the Voice) Being here must bring back memories of being a monk.
String.Dest: （吼声之道）在这儿肯定能唤起你僧侣的记忆。

String.Source: Thus the younger acolytes were given the privilege of fetching the water and fish from the river below.
String.Dest: 因此那年轻的祀祭被授予了从河底取水和鱼的特权

String.Source: (The Way of the Voice) Being here must bring back memories of being a monk.
String.Dest: （吼声之道）在这儿肯定能唤起你僧侣的记忆。

String.Source: I do not know if my fondness for fish was a result of my longing for those halcyon days, or if the fish itself gave me nostalgia for the mundane.
String.Dest: 我不清楚我对鱼的喜爱是否源于我对宁静生活的向往，或是否鱼本身让我产生了思乡之情。

String.Source: There was nothing natural about their deaths. Savos and Mirabelle were killed.
String.Dest: 他们的死亡不是天生的。萨沃斯和米拉贝勒是被杀的。

String.Source: Ah, but it was. It is because any moment can bring death, that we learn to value life. I am reminded of a parable, if you wish to hear it.
String.Dest: 啊，但曾经是。恰恰是因为随时会死，所以我学会珍惜生命。我想起一个寓言，你想听一下吗？

String.Source: Farewell.
String.Dest: 再会。

String.Source: May you be safe, wherever you go.
String.Dest: 无论你去哪，愿平安常伴你左右。

String.Source: May safety and prosperity find you, wherever you go.
String.Dest: 无论你去哪，愿平安与成功常伴你左右。

String.Source: Goodbye.
String.Dest: 再见。

String.Source: Well met.
String.Dest: 幸会。

String.Source: Greetings, traveler.
String.Dest: 你好，旅行者。

String.Source: Hello.
String.Dest: 哈啰。

String.Source: Hello.
String.Dest: 你好。

String.Source: Good to see you again.
String.Dest: 很高兴再次见到你。

String.Source: Ah, you return.
String.Dest: 啊,你回来了。

String.Source: What can Qa'Dojo do for you?
String.Dest: 奎兜啾能为你做些什么？

String.Source: The drop is steep, but perhaps if we can climb down the walls, we can avoid learning the hard way if the water is shallow.
String.Dest: 太陡了，可如果我们能从墙上爬下去，就不用冒险去赌下面的水浅不浅啦。

String.Source: One wonders how many have passed under the watchful gaze of these twin eagles. For them, we are but tomorrow's history.
String.Dest: 人们不知道有多少人已经在这双鹰的密切注意中逝去了。对它们来说，我们只不过是明日的历史。

String.Source: So we have trekked through a cave teeming with violence, and have come to a calm. Yet this tableau of serenity belies the danger ahead. Be ready.
String.Dest: 所以我们已经跋涉越过了一个充斥着暴力的洞穴，来到了这一处宁静所在。但是这平静的表面不过是掩盖了其下的危险。多加小心。

String.Source: A shrine to Julianos. As you can see, it is not only the Daedra who have their ideals twisted by mortals.
String.Dest: 尤里安诺斯的祭坛呢...喏，如你所见，在人间的认知被扭曲的可不止魔族而已。

String.Source: This cave paints an interesting picture. The light shines on this dark ritual, to grow the seeds of evil.
String.Dest: 这个洞穴描绘出了一幅有趣的画面。光线洒在这黑暗的仪式上，邪恶的种子破土生长。

String.Source: A foul mist walks these ruins, but it is not the work of Peryite. It does not end life, but corrupts it.
String.Dest: 一个邪恶的灵体在这废墟上飘荡, 但这并不是魄伊特干的。它不会杀死生命,但会腐化它。

String.Source: It seems I was wrong. This does not appear to be a misunderstood wonder, but rather a dark ritual disguised as something wondrous.
String.Dest: 看起来我错了。这好像是个误会，但也总比一个被伪装成奇妙的魔法的黑暗仪式要好。

String.Source: I am proof that a steep fall is not always such a bad thing. It may lead you to unexpected places.
String.Dest: 我证明，一次急剧的坠落不一定都是坏事。也行会带你到一处意想不到的地方。

String.Source: The drop is steep, but perhaps if we can climb down the walls, we can avoid learning the hard way if the water is shallow.
String.Dest: 太陡了，可如果我们能从墙上爬下去，就不用冒险去赌下面的水浅不浅啦。

String.Source: I need to trade some things with you.
String.Dest: 我想跟你交易一些东西。

String.Source: Good. Our things are many. Let us find the appropriate balance.
String.Dest: 很好。我们还有很多事儿要做。让我们在这之中寻找一个恰当的平衡。

String.Source: Wait here for a moment.
String.Dest: 在这儿等一下。

String.Source: Wait here.
String.Dest: 在这里等着。

String.Source: I understand.
String.Dest: 我明白了。

String.Source: I need you to do something for me.
String.Dest: 我需要你为我做件事情。

String.Source: What can Qa'Dojo do for you?
String.Dest: 奎兜啾能为你做些什么？

String.Source: It's nothing. Never mind.
String.Dest: 没什么事，不用担心。

String.Source: Very well.
String.Dest: 很好。

String.Source: Yes. Let me show you.
String.Dest: 不错，你看看。

String.Source: Alright.
String.Dest: 好吧。

String.Source: Take your time.
String.Dest: 抓紧时间。

String.Source: Take your time.
String.Dest: 慢慢儿来。

String.Source: Alas, it's time for us to part ways.
String.Dest: 行啦，是咱们分道扬镳的时候啦。

String.Source: {Departs}
String.Dest: {离开 }

String.Source: Alas, it's time for us to part ways.
String.Dest: 行啦，是咱们分道扬镳的时候啦。

String.Source: Very well. Perhaps like the Count and the carpenter, I will return to whence I came.
String.Dest: 好吧。也许跟那位伯爵和那木匠一样，我会回到原先的地方。

String.Source: Follow me.
String.Dest: 跟我走。

String.Source: Then let us wander these white sands and find our destination.
String.Dest: 我们好好在这白沙上走一走，找找我们的目的地吧。

String.Source: Is there anything else?
String.Dest: 还有别的么？

String.Source: I am sorry, but it cannot be done.
String.Dest: 我很抱歉，但我做不到。

String.Source: I understand.
String.Dest: 我明白了。

String.Source: Take your time.
String.Dest: 抓紧时间。

String.Source: Take your time.
String.Dest: 慢慢儿来。

String.Source: Zzzzz...
String.Dest: Zzzzz……

String.Source: So Leifnarr is dead. The question now is, who stands to gain from the sale of Heartwood Mill? Answer that, and you find his murderer.
String.Dest: 那么雷夫纳尔已经死了。问题在于，谁会因出售心木磨坊而得益？找到这问题的答案，就找到了谋杀他的人。

String.Source: You were a Companion before, but now you are one they trust. I suspect it will not be long before you are truly family...in name, and in blood.
String.Dest: 你之前是一个同伴，但现在你是他们信赖之人。你会成为他们真正的家人……在名义上如此，血液之中也如此。

String.Source: The steps here remind me of a monastery. Perhaps this place was once known as the Temple of the Silent Moons.
String.Dest: 这里的台阶让我回想起一座修道院来。也许这个地方曾经被称为静月神殿呢。

String.Source: When words fail, a good brawl is a healthy way to vent one's frustrations. To bottle them inside will only make things worse in the end.
String.Dest: 当无法用言语表达时，打一架或许是个不错的发泄方法。压制他们只能让事情变得更糟。

String.Source: So this is not a cave of conjurers, but rather an excavation of some kind. What manner of ruin is this, for it to attract such dark forces?
String.Dest: 所以这不是一个巫师的洞穴，而更像是某种古迹。这是怎样的废墟才会吸引如此的黑暗之力呢？

String.Source: From the egg of creation, the next world attempts to hatch. Yet the fox lurks outside the coop, and we need not guile to enter. The fence is open.
String.Dest: 从蛋被创造之日起，就准备被孵化出来。但狐狸就潜伏在鸡舍里，我们无需计谋就能进入。栅栏已经被打开了。

String.Source: It is said that the dragon priests worshipped power. Yet the irony is, it appears the Staff of Magnus is designed to contain it.
String.Dest: 据说，龙祭祀崇尚着力量。然而讽刺的是，看起来，玛格努斯之杖，是用来牵制力量的。

String.Source: We seem to be descending further and further. As if entering the bowels of some cavernous beast.
String.Dest: 我们好像在一直向下走。感觉就像我们走进了某种穴居生物的肠道。

String.Source: Goblets. Ewers. Fine rugs and noble chairs. Yet elegance cannot conceal the vampire's true nature, as evidenced by this cage.
String.Dest: 酒杯。注壶。柔软的地摊和精致的凳子。然而，优雅无法掩饰的吸血鬼的本性，通过这鲜血淋淋的笼子就得以证明。

String.Source: By Azura! To have fought in this Arena, to have challenged a dragon of bone and breath...I am a foolish monk, and a lucky one.
String.Dest: 阿祖拉在上！在这个竞技场里战斗，去挑战龙之骸骨和龙息……我真是个愚蠢的修道士，也是个幸运至极的家伙。

String.Source: The mage we seek is called the Augur of Dunlain, and to "augur" is to prophesize. Funny how often believing a prophecy is what leads to its fruition.
String.Dest: 我们找的魔法叫预言师杜兰, 然后 "预兆"是做出预言。有趣的是，经常是Funny how often believing a prophecy is what leads to its fruition.

String.Source: So you have spared The Caller, despite knowing her practices. Is this because you fear her magic, despise vampires, or prefer a peaceful solution?
String.Dest: 所以你就算知道她的做法了，也还是宽恕了来访者。这到底是因为你怕了她的魔法了，还是轻视吸血鬼？亦或是想找到一个更为和平的解决方法？?

String.Source: I wonder what the true effects are of The Caller's death. Will the vampires thrive in her absence? It is a curious question, but one with no answer.
String.Dest: 我很好奇召唤者死亡的真正影响。她已不存在的情况下，吸血鬼还能活得好好的吗？这是一个令人饶有兴趣的问题，却没有答案。

String.Source: There is much you have not told us about this Caller, Orthorn. All conjurers are callers, but what makes her special? Who, or what, does she call?
String.Dest: 奥松恩，你好像没跟我们说清楚关于这位“召唤者”小姐的事。所有的召唤师都会召唤，那她这个名字有什么特别的？还是她能特别召唤谁？还是什么东西？

String.Source: Rogue mages and alchemists experiment with vampire dust for its magical properties. But one need only chew on it to "see" its effects, so to speak.
String.Dest: 流浪的法师和炼金术士因为吸血鬼之尘的特性而去用它进行试验。恕我直言，但有人只是需要咀嚼它去“看”它的效果。

String.Source: Curiously, there were only 2 points of emphasis on the map. It seems all of Tamriel has its eyes on Skyrim.
String.Dest: 奇怪的是，这地图上只有两个需要重视的要点。看起来全泰姆瑞尔大陆的目光都集中在天际省上了。

String.Source: Things have calmed here, but back at the College, the storm rages. We should return.
String.Dest: 这边的情况稳定了，可学院那边还有风暴在肆虐。我们必须回去。

String.Source: What strange jewel have we uncovered, and more importantly, what has this discovery set into motion? This is only the beginning, I am afraid.
String.Dest: 我们发现的这是什么奇怪的宝石啊？更重要的是，这个发现会引发什么事情。这恐怕仅仅是个开始。

String.Source: It appears this aqueduct is central to this place. The water is pumped in, boiled, and transformed into the vapor which breathes life into this ruin.
String.Dest: 看起来这条管子像是这里的核心。外面的水被抽进来烧开，变成蒸汽为这个遗迹提供动力。

String.Source: When mages dig into the unknown, it is often an accident waiting to happen. Yet the word "accident" does not imply a negative result.
String.Dest: 当法师们在未知的世界里上下求索时，意外常常不期而至。然而“意外”并不总意味着糟糕的后果。

String.Source: So you are now a student of the College. I am glad to see this Tolfdir is your instructor. Let us hope he is as principled as he is cautious.
String.Dest: 所以你现在是这个学院的学生。很高兴看到托夫迪尔成为你的导师。因为他有着既谨慎又刚正的性格。

String.Source: In war, it is often iron that turns the tide. 5 farmers with cheaply made iron swords, may vanquish a well-paid knight dressed in steel.
String.Dest: 在战争时代，铁器就是王道。五个菜刀老农能砍倒钢甲骑兵呢！

String.Source: Many children's tales that tell the virtue of hard work, but in reality, there are relationships like Birna's and Ranmir's where laziness rules.
String.Dest: 有很多童话故事讲述着辛勤工作的美德，可现实中确实有Birna和Ranmir那样的奉行懒惰至上的家庭。

String.Source: There are those here who fear what they do not understand, and there are others who bravely tamper with the unknown. In the end, both are dangerous.
String.Dest: 有的人害怕他们不懂的事物，也有的人勇敢地玩弄着未知。最终，都是危险的。

String.Source: A long hallway and a single door. It is almost as if they are testing our patience. For it is easy to rush ahead when there is no other path.
String.Dest: 漫长的走廊和孤零零的一道门。鉴于没有别的路可走很容易冲过去的情况下，这几乎就像是在考验我们的耐性。

String.Source: In these catacombs there are Draugr who lie down to sleep, and Draugr who lie in wait.
String.Dest: 这些墓穴里沉眠着无数的尸鬼，他们之中有些已然长眠，有些却静静等待着侵入者。

String.Source: The will of the Gods is evident. Vaermina's influence will inspire the people here, but you intervened before it could corrupt.
String.Dest: 神的意愿很清楚。瓦尔迷纳的声望激励着这里的人民, 但你在失控之前介入了.

String.Source: Anska, sometimes our family bonds give us strength. Other times our bloodline makes us dependent on ghosts. I hope your mind is clear.
String.Dest: Anska, sometimes our family bonds give us strength. Other times our bloodline makes us dependent on ghosts. I hope your mind is clear.

String.Source: Clearpine Pond. Life grows here in abundance, and in Tamriel, with life comes magic. Those who seek its power come in many forms.
String.Dest: 清松池塘。生命在这里欣欣向荣，同时在塔玛瑞尔，魔法伴随生命而来，那些寻求魔法之力的人也变得各式各样。

String.Source: Madness and genius are intertwined. This priest calls Vaermina evil, because he fails to see that evil does not exist.
String.Dest: 疯狂与天才是交织在一起的。这个牧师把维尔米那叫做恶魔，是因为他没法认识到其实恶魔并不存在。

String.Source: The beliefs of this temple are fickle. But Eight or Nine, Aedra or Daedra, the Gods are Gods. It is not up to mortals to decide.
String.Dest: 这寺庙的信仰变化无常。但是无论八圣还是九圣，圣灵还是魔族，神就是神。这不是凡人所能决定的。

String.Source: The Gold Ribbon of Merit. To me, it is very much a story of chaos and order; a duel between a marksman of the wild and a tournament champion.
String.Dest: 象征着功勋的金缎带。对我来说，这更多的是一个关于混沌与秩序的故事，一场荒野神射手与锦标赛冠军之间的较量。

String.Source: I do not see the need for so many clothes. A monk has a single robe, and he wears it like his own fur.
String.Dest: 我不觉得有必要弄这么多衣服。每个僧侣都有自己的长袍，而他会把这长袍当作自己的皮毛穿着。

String.Source: A wise monk once said, when one returns from a long journey, they may find their home much smaller than when they left it.
String.Dest: 子曾经曰过，归家的游子一定会觉得自己家比印象中要小。

String.Source: To destroy Dragon Bridge is to cut off the enemy's reinforcements. Yet I have a feeling this bridge has survived many such attempts.
String.Dest: 毁灭龙桥就是切断了敌人的后援。但我感觉这桥已经在很多次这样的尝试下幸存.

String.Source: A persistent dog will often choose his own master, and not allow that master to refuse. One wonders who is truly in charge.
String.Dest: 固执的老狗一般会自己选主人，而且拒绝接受主人的回绝。这让好奇谁才是主人。

String.Source: Skulls and enchantment tables. Blacksmith tools and bottles of wine. The items here are a timeline, showing a history of this fort's occupants.
String.Dest: Skulls and enchantment tables. Blacksmith tools and bottles of wine. The items here are a timeline, showing a history of this fort's occupants.

String.Source: Someone has already raided this crypt. And whoever it was did not care how many of his companions had fallen.
String.Dest: 有人已经洗劫过这个地穴了，是那种根本不在乎自己队伍战损的亡命之徒干的。

String.Source: Movarth was a wicked creature, yet one can't help but admire the tenacity it took to survive for centuries. Not to mention strength, guile, and luck.
String.Dest: 莫瓦斯是个邪恶的生物，但我不得不佩服一下他生存了几百年的坚韧劲儿。更别说是他的力量，狡诈，和运气了。

String.Source: While some prefer to study the composition of ingredients, this Lami chooses to rely on random chance. Who is to say which will yield better results?
String.Dest: 在别人学习药剂配方的时候，拉米这家伙选择去碰运气。你说，是谁有好结果。

String.Source: Hroggar's actions are not unusual. The vampire is like a moonflower. It blooms only at night, petals as white as Secunda. Beautiful and poisonous.
String.Dest: 赫鲁加的行为再正常不过了。吸血鬼就如同一朵只在黑夜中绽放的月光花，花瓣洁白如塞康达。美丽却致命。

String.Source: They say a woman who lives here abandoned her family to join the Stormcloaks. Perhaps to abandon the Gods was the far greater crime.
String.Dest: 他们说一位住在这的女人抛弃了她的家庭而加入风暴斗篷。 也许抛弃了诸神才是更大的罪行。

String.Source: We must approach this investigation with caution. Do not be tempted by the easy answer, especially when there is no evidence to support it.
String.Dest: 你要仔细调查这个，不要轻信那些显而易见的结论，尤其是没有明确的证据支持你的判断的时候.

String.Source: In one room, a beautiful courtyard. Down the hall, a torture chamber. And so in a matter of seconds we are shown the duality of mortals.
String.Dest: 在一个漂亮院子的房间中。沿着走廊下来，有一个酷刑室。不止如此，几秒钟内我们看到了人类的善恶多变.

String.Source: What could have killed these men? Falmer? Dwarves? Judging by the cups and position of the bodies, it was a combination of neglect and fear.
String.Dest: 什么玩意儿害死了这些人？雪精灵？锻模？由这些杯子和尸体的位置判断，他们死前处于一种懈怠和恐慌交织在一起的情绪中。

String.Source: It is a privilege to adventure with an archer of your skill. There will be little trouble hunting for food in the wild.
String.Dest: 对一名冒险者来说，跟一个有助于你的弓箭手在一起是种荣幸。在野外猎取食物的时候会有点儿麻烦。

String.Source: The two-handed weapon is a dangerous sword. Always tumbling forward, dragging its owner behind it. It is up to you to provide the counterweight.
String.Dest: 双手武器是一种危险的武器。永远横冲直撞，拖拽着它的主人向前。你只不过是向它提供平衡而已。

String.Source: I have known Daedric blood to have magical properties, but I was not aware of its use in smithing. One learns something new every day.
String.Dest: 我知道魔族的血有神奇的特性,但我没意识到把它用到锻造上。知识日新月异啊

String.Source: In war, it is often iron that turns the tide. 5 farmers with cheaply made iron swords, may vanquish a well-paid knight dressed in steel.
String.Dest: 在战争时代，铁器就是王道。五个菜刀老农还能砍倒钢甲骑兵呢。

String.Source: They say a beast will grow as large as its surroundings will allow. Judging by the size of this excavation, Nimhe will be a formidable foe.
String.Dest: 他们说，一头野兽能尽环境允许的量尽情成长变大。根据开凿出来的洞穴大小，尼姆赫会是个强大的对手。

String.Source: The Thalmor insist on creating resentment, as a weakened Empire benefits only them. We should not assist them further.
String.Dest: 因为一个虚弱的帝国不仅仅能让他们收益，所以梭默才会那样执着于制造纷争。我们不应该再协助他们了。

String.Source: Ah, here you are, free from Cidhna Mine. It was smart to submit to the guards. An opening always presents itself to those who wait for it.
String.Dest: 啊，你来了，从希讷矿场出来了。向守卫示弱是很聪明的举动。道路总会为愿意寻路的人打开。

String.Source: Beware. Whatever killed these two still lurks about. Or perhaps is merely playing dead.
String.Dest: 小心，杀掉这两个的不管是什么，可能仍然在周围潜伏着。也有可能仅仅是在装死。

String.Source: This Lurbuk does not let criticism dissuade him. Yet it is his confidence that is the true deterrent to his growth as a bard.
String.Dest: 这个卢布克根本听不进别人说他不好。而就是他的这种自负，成为了他吟游诗人道路上的绊脚石。

String.Source: So the Orc bard has perished. It is unfortunate, but things that are...unnatural tend to have a difficult time surviving.
String.Dest: 所以那个兽人吟游诗人已经挂了。真是不幸，但凡事都是如此……异类往往难以生存。

String.Source: Boethiah and Molag Bal. You see, there are Daedra who consider each other adversaries, just as there are those who consider the Aedra to be allies.
String.Dest: 波耶西亚与莫拉格·巴尔。你瞧，他们是那些互相对方是敌人的魔族，就像那些认为神族是同盟的人。

String.Source: There are many things in this world that eat the dead. Perhaps not enough, if the Draugr are any indication.
String.Dest: 这个世界上吃尸体的玩意儿多的是。这些尸鬼可能预示着什么。

String.Source: Verulus and Eola. Arkay and Namira. An eternal struggle, as is fitting for those who rule the realm of eternity. Who will you side with on this day?
String.Dest: 维鲁鲁斯和爱欧拉. 阿尔凯和娜米拉.一场永恒的争斗, 为的是拟定谁统治领地。这一天，你要站在哪一方？

String.Source: Namira's presence is strong in these Warrens, just as Mephala's haunts the rest of Markarth.
String.Dest: 娜米拉的灵魂在这些贫民窟中十分强大,就如梅法拉在马卡斯城部分地区经常出没一样。

String.Source: It is not uncommon for an elder mage or warrior to find an isolated cabin like this, so that she may meditate and find her own absolution.
String.Dest: 年老的法师或者战士寻找一个像是这样偏僻的小屋并不是什么怪事，看起来她也许在寻找她自己救赎的方式。

String.Source: So the old mage was a witch. This in itself is not enough to condemn her. This did not have to end in death, had she shown more restraint.
String.Dest: 那么这个老法师是个女巫。就这个事实而言谴责她是不够的，但是这件事没必要以死亡收尾，毕竟她已经表现的相当克制。

String.Source: It is a great honor to join a Temple, and to devote yourself to service. You should not worry about this child Sybil, or her family.
String.Dest: 加入寺庙并献身服务其中是个巨大的荣耀，你用不着担心西比尔这孩子或者是她的家人。

String.Source: There are many paths to success. Persistence, luck, necessity, divine intervention...This boy may need all to compensate for his lack of talent.
String.Dest: 导向成功的因素有很多，毅力、运气、资源、神的帮助……那孩子缺乏天赋，因而他需要上面的提及到的。

String.Source: The Silver-Bloods believe wealth equals power, but to buy alliances with gold means to deal with those willing to sell their honor.
String.Dest: 银血相信财富等同于力量，但用钱来买联盟则意味着要耍手段来对付那些愿意背弃自身荣耀的人。

String.Source: When twin moons are trapped in a pail of water, only when that water is spilled are they set free. This conspiracy is a pail about to tip over.
String.Dest: 当两个月亮被困于一桶水里的时候，只有把水泼掉才能还它们自由。这个阴谋就是那个该被翻倒的桶。

String.Source: I find it admirable that in the face of adversity, these miners still find time to fuss over the mundane. It shows their strength.
String.Dest: 对于这些矿工在面对逆境时，仍然有时间去操心世俗之事，我真的深感敬佩。这显露了他们的强大。

String.Source: Elders like Bothela have shed a lifetime of sweat and tears. Only now, as their bodies are empty of moisture, are their minds full of wisdom.
String.Dest: 像波塞拉那样的老人已然经历了悲喜交杂的一声。如今，她们干枯的身躯中已只余无穷的智慧。

String.Source: It is no surprise the Forsworn rely on Boethiah. When strength fails, subterfuge is a tool that allows the oppressed to achieve a balance.
String.Dest: 弃誓者依赖波耶西亚毫不奇怪。当力量不足时，阴谋诡计则成为受压迫者反抗的工具。

String.Source: Even a destructive force such as Mehrunes Dagon has a purpose. These pieces of the Mythic Dawn show us how tenuous our lives are.
String.Dest: 即使是如梅鲁涅斯．大衮一般的毁灭性的力量也是有意义的。这些神话黎明让我们明白了我们的生命有多么脆弱。

String.Source: These miners often complain about hard work. But then how will they face life's challenges, when nothing of value comes easy?
String.Dest: 这些矿工们总是抱怨干活太累。但像他们这样该怎么面对人生中的挑战呢？天下没有免费的午餐啊！

String.Source: Many of the locals here ask me how best to pass the time. I tell them to treasure every moment, for each second is the first and last of its kind.
String.Dest: 很多当地人问我怎么才能最好的打发时间。我告诉他们珍惜每一个瞬间，因为每秒钟的经历都是这辈子第一也是最后一次。

String.Source: This shrine is a reminder. Just as bandits can pray to the Aedra, so too can good mortals pray to the Daedra.
String.Dest: 这座祭坛提醒了我。正如强盗也可以向神族祈祷的那样，当然也可以有好人向魔族祈祷啦。

String.Source: Ah, the Hunter's Rest. A home for those who have none. A mead hall where the roof is the roof of the world.
String.Dest: 啊,猎人休息处。无家可归之人的家。A mead hall where the roof is the roof of the world.

String.Source: So you have joined this Temple of Valor, this Hall of Companions. The word companion is apt, for shield-brother and shield-sister fight as family.
String.Dest: 你已经成为这座战友团勇气大厅的一员了。战友这个词如此平易，因为盾牌兄弟和盾牌姐妹们如一家人一般并肩作战。

String.Source: Moons protect us! The tower...it's been completely obliterated!
String.Dest: 月亮庇佑我们！那座塔...已经被完全摧毁了。

String.Source: Whiterun is the very fulcrum of Skyrim. If a dragon attacks here, all will know. There will be no denying they have returned.
String.Dest: 雪漫城是天际省的轴心。如果有龙袭击了这里，所有人都会知道的。龙的回归将无可否认。

String.Source: Ah, so now the other piece falls into place. On one side, the return of the dragons. And to balance it, the rise of the dragonborn.
String.Dest: 所有事情都是相生相克，遵循着矛盾的逻辑。一方面是龙族以不可阻挡之势回归，同时冥冥之中也早已注定龙裔的崛起。

String.Source: You have slain a dragon, become Thane of Whiterun, and now the Greybeards have called you. Truly, the winds of fate swirl around you.
String.Dest: 你已经杀了一条龙，成为了雪漫城的男爵。而现在，灰胡子在呼唤于你。的确，命运之风在索绕着你。

String.Source: I have heard the Greybeards do not like to alter the course of history. But to do nothing is an act that has just as many consequences.
String.Dest: 我听说灰胡子不喜欢干涉历史的发展进程。但毫无作为同样也是一种影响结果的方式。

String.Source: The Companions grieve, and they weep. Because death is always unexpected, even when it is the one thing we can all expect.
String.Dest: 战友团的人悲痛着，哭泣着。因为死亡总是突如其来的。即使那也是我们所期待的东西。

String.Source: Riften is renowned for its fishery. I would very much like to taste the salmon steak, or perhaps, chef willing, a flounder marinated in tomato sauce.
String.Dest: 裂谷城因其丰富的渔产而闻名。我很想尝尝鲑鱼排，或者，如果厨师愿意做的话，更想尝尝比目鱼番茄酱汤。

String.Source: I wonder if stores like this are having their prices undercut by the Khajiit caravans, and whether they will brook such behavior as profits dwindle.
String.Dest: 我怀疑像这样的商店会不会像虎人商店那样削价, 并接受由此带来的收益下降.

String.Source: A fellow monk once asked me how I can endure such lengthy travel. "You carry many burdens," I told him, "but the foremost rest in your mind."
String.Dest: 有一次修道士随从问我是怎样才忍受如此漫长的旅途。“尽管你带了很多行李，”我对他说道，“但最重要的休息在你脑海里。”

String.Source: The stores in Skyrim are well and good, but I wonder if one pays for the atmosphere.
String.Dest: 天际省的商店令人满意, 但我不知是否有人为大气埋单.

String.Source: Giants are the living embodiment of the delicate balance between cities and the wild. Their strength ensures the land will not be poisoned by order.
String.Dest: 巨人就是让城市与野外达成微妙平衡的化身。它们的强大让自然不至于被人类所破坏殆尽。

String.Source: It is fascinating to think entire civilizations begin in mines like this, where a single piece of ore is cut out from the crust of rock.
String.Dest: 真是令人惊讶啊，想想整个一座城市的建立就是从这样的矿坑里的一片石头开凿出一片矿石开始的。

String.Source: The opinions of mortals are like the cups of an inn. They overflow and must be emptied if they are to learn the way.
String.Dest: 凡人的意见就如旅店里的杯子。已经溢出了，如果他们学会方法的话，那么该清空一下了。

String.Source: If you give someone a gift, say thank you. For if you seek thanks and are not yourself thankful, then your aim is to be admired, not benevolent.
String.Dest: 若你给某人一份礼物，那么说声谢谢。对于你只是想听别人感谢而不是自身真的想帮助人，那么你的目的令人敬佩，却不仁慈的。

String.Source: A wise monk once said a burden spoken is one relieved.
String.Dest: 一位睿智的修道士曾说过：倾之以诉，如释重负；缄默不语，心中自痛。

String.Source: Both the Khajiit and Redguard are desert people, but Skyrim is not as harsh when your mind is clear and you carry your own coat.
String.Dest: 虽然说虎人和红卫皆为荒漠之人，不过倘若他们动动脑子穿得暖和些，其实在天际也没那么难受。

String.Source: Ah, a cemetery. From nothing they came, to nothing they return, and from nothing they will return again.
String.Dest: 啊，墓地。 他们赤裸裸的生，赤裸裸的死，然后再次赤裸裸的回到这个世上。

String.Source: I have visited many shrines dedicated to both the Aedra and Daedra, and yet all pale in comparison to Azura.
String.Dest: 我见过各色各样的伊德拉和魔族圣殿。然而它们与阿祖拉的相比则显得如此苍白无力。

String.Source: There were once many small towns like this that gave food and shelter to a monk in need. Sadly, those days have long passed.
String.Dest: 曾经有很多像这样的小镇，会在修道士危难之时提供给他们食物和住所。可悲的是，那些日子早已过去了。

String.Source: The Shrine of Azura. What mortal can look upon such magnificence, and claim its builders were inspired by evil?
String.Dest: 阿祖拉圣地。有谁会认为这座辉煌之物和它建造者的灵感都来自于邪恶？

String.Source: Oh! It is snowing! I would like to make a snowcat. We can use the flower stems as whiskers.
String.Dest: 噢！下雪了！我要堆一只雪猫。咱们找点花茎杆来当胡须。

String.Source: As students, we climbed steps like this every day, with buckets of water from the well below. Perhaps not 7000 steps, but there were many.
String.Dest: 如学生一般，我们每天都像这样拿着一桶从井里打来的水一步一个脚印地向上爬。也许不止7000步，反正很多就是了。

String.Source: There is a tale of a clumsy monk who spilled water from his bucket whenever he climbed to the temple, and from it bloomed a garden.
String.Dest: 据说是有一个笨笨的僧人，每次挑水上神殿去都会一路洒出很多水，就这样把这儿灌溉成了花园。

String.Source: There is a tension in the air here. The balance is fragile. We would do well not to mettle.
String.Dest: 空气中透着些许紧张气氛。平衡很快就会被打破。我们会尽全力示弱的。

String.Source: State your beliefs, but think twice before speaking. Measure every word, but let your words be forceful. The Greybeards remind me of such teachings.
String.Dest: 说出你的信念，但是在说之前要三思。斟酌你的用词，但要话语要有力。灰胡子给了我这样的教诲。

String.Source: They say there are two prisons in Markarth, the mine and the warrens.
String.Dest: 他们说马卡斯城有两所监狱，矿洞和贫民窟。

String.Source: Dawnstar. Many believe this to be the end of the world. The ocean is nothing more than an empty space on a page, the end of a chapter, not the book.
String.Dest: 晨星城。很多人认为这里是世界尽头。大海仅只是世界长卷上的空白页，是章节而非全书的终点。

String.Source: I think the tavern girl here likes me. She was very complimentary of my coat.
String.Dest: 我觉得旅馆中的那女孩喜欢我，她每次都在赞美我的大衣。

String.Source: The road is long, and it is wise to rest on occasion. There must also be time to meditate, as the two are not the same.
String.Dest: 路途是漫长的,要聪明地利用时间休息。同样，还要留够时间来进行策划，因为两者是不同的。

String.Source: Talos. His ascension proves we are all part of the heavens and the earth, and we all have a part in the harmony.
String.Dest: 塔洛斯。他的成神证明了我们皆为天堂和地球的一部分，并且我们皆为协调的一部分。

String.Source: I can always tell whether I will like a city by their selection of fish.
String.Dest: 我只看居民怎么挑选鱼货就能判断出我是否喜欢这座城市。

String.Source: Windhelm. This city has always made my whiskers tingle.
String.Dest: 风盔城。这座城市总是让我连胡子都在哆嗦啊。

String.Source: I once knew a Khajiit who said his ears would twitch whenever someone spoke of him. I wonder if someone speaks of me now.
String.Dest: 我曾听到过一个虎人说每当有人说起它时，它的耳朵都会抽搐。我很好奇现在是不是有人提及我？

String.Source: Bandits. The fates are not kind to them.
String.Dest: 强盗们。命运对他们不公平。

String.Source: There was once a village like this outside the temple where I trained. They brought alms, and we offered wisdom in return.
String.Dest: 在我受训的神庙外面也有这样一个小镇。他们捐助我们物品，我们回赠他们智慧。

String.Source: Vampires. Now would not be a good time to be one.
String.Dest: 吸血鬼。现在可不是加入他们的好时机。

String.Source: The days and seasons change, as do all things. It is the blood of Padomay, the Daedra, who are the agents.
String.Dest: 时移世易，所有事物都会变化。魔族，帕杜梅的血脉，同时也是其代理者。

String.Source: It is very important that we refer to the Aedra as such, and not the Divines, less mortals raise their status beyond their counterparts.
String.Dest: 我们指的是神族什么的，而不是圣灵，这点很重要。基本没几个凡人把神族的地位放在和他们地位相同的圣灵之上。

String.Source: Does this farm have leeks? Qa'Dojo is fond of leeks. They go quite well with steamed fish.
String.Dest: 这个农场有韭菜？奎兜啾最喜欢韭菜，韭菜跟鱼一起蒸的味道，超赞！！

String.Source: They say there is a thin line between mages and warlocks. Sometimes, perhaps. Other times it is very thick. Such is the trouble with labels.
String.Dest: 他们说法师和术士之间没什么区别。也许有时是这样，但更多时候两者之间的差别很大。这就是被打上标签的麻烦之处啊。

String.Source: There is far more gray on my fur then I remember. It comes so slowly, yet so suddenly.
String.Dest: 我毛发上的银丝比我印象中多了很多。它们来的如此缓慢，却又如此突然。

String.Source: It is wise for all returning travelers to pray at a shrine. When chaos rules our bodies, it may infect the next mortal, so we ask the Aedra for calm.
String.Dest: 这是所有归来者在神庙里祈求的愿望. 当混沌占据我们的身体时, 它会感染周边的人, 所以我们向神族祈求平息。

String.Source: Why do they call liquor "spirits?" Although I have heard the spiced wine here is indeed heavenly.
String.Dest: 他们为什么把兑水的酒精叫做“烈酒”呢？尽管我听说这里的加香葡萄酒宛如天物。

String.Source: While it is safer to use the main roads and thoroughfares, a brisk walk off the path may provide an opportunity to contemplate nature.
String.Dest: 虽然在主要干道行走更为安全，不过在羊肠小道上蹦跶蹦跶或能让我们更亲近大自然。

String.Source: The forest is thinning here. The trees are finding new life as catapults.
String.Dest: 在这里，森林正在变小。树木正在离开这里谋求新生。

String.Source: Any coastal town ought to have good fishing. But the people here seem only to fish for rocks.
String.Dest: 一般港口小镇都该有像样的渔业。可这里的人好像捕捞的都是石头。

String.Source: I wonder where machines fall in the balance of all things. Surely they have a place.
String.Dest: 我想知道机器处于所有事物平衡中的哪里。他们肯定有一份位置的。

String.Source: Could it not be said that we are all machines in some respects? Our bones are metal, blood is oil, and our tails, well, it's not a perfect analogy.
String.Dest: 难道它没说在一些方面来上说我们都是机器?我们的骨头为金属，血液为油！还有我们的尾巴，嗯，这并非完美。诸如此类。

String.Source: The lake here looks like a good spot to fish, and an even better place to meditate.
String.Dest: 这湖看起来是个捕鱼的好地方，更是冥想的好地方。

String.Source: In Morthal, rumors float through the air like dandelion seeds. Be careful not to let the weeds take root.
String.Dest: 在墨索尔城,谣言像蒲公英种子漂浮在空中。小心不要节外生枝。

String.Source: This town looks cozy, and its people warm.
String.Dest: 这个小镇看上去很安详，这的人们也挺热心的。

String.Source: It is strange that the undead are mostly human. It is possible the beast races are not easily bewitched by immortality's promise.
String.Dest: 奇怪的是，亡灵大多数都是人类。也许是兽族不容易被永恒之诺施法。

String.Source: Not many people can find the place, to be honest, since it's not on any map.
String.Dest: 说实话，没多少人能找到这个地方。因为那里在任何一份地图上都没有标示。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: The only reason the guard were able to arrest my father is because he was forced to spend the night in Solitude.
String.Dest: 守卫逮捕我父亲唯一可行的理由就是他非自愿而不得不在独孤城过了一夜。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: Is that all?
String.Dest: 就这样？

String.Source: I've suffered worse!
String.Dest: I've suffered worse!

String.Source: Your blows do not hurt me!
String.Dest: 你的攻击伤不了我！

String.Source: Hrrragh!
String.Dest: 喝啊啊啊！

String.Source: Hyargh!
String.Dest: 嘿呀！

String.Source: Eyargh!
String.Dest: 咿呀！

String.Source: Arrrgh!
String.Dest: 啊啊啊呀!

String.Source: The day is yours! I yield!
String.Dest: 你赢了，我投降！

String.Source: You are wounded!
String.Dest: 你受伤了！

String.Source: Growing weary?
String.Dest: 厌烦了吗？

String.Source: I will vanquish you, dragon!
String.Dest: 我会战胜你的，龙！

String.Source: You cannot win!
String.Dest: 你赢不了的！

String.Source: It is over, before it begins!
String.Dest: 还没开始就结束了！

String.Source: I will send you into the light!
String.Dest: 我要把你净化掉！

String.Source: I will vanquish you, dragon!
String.Dest: 我会战胜你的，龙！

String.Source: You cannot win!
String.Dest: 你赢不了的！

String.Source: I will send you into the light!
String.Dest: 我要把你净化掉！

String.Source: Ah, Peryite. One should not cast aspersions on the power of disease. For sometimes it is the infection that provides the cure.
String.Dest: 哎！魄伊特。无人该质疑瘟疾之力。因为瘟疾之力时无解药。

String.Source: I would like to investigate this Wolfskull cave. When this farmer speaks of the unnatural, he could very well be speaking of the exotic.
String.Dest: 我想调查这个狼骨洞穴。而这个农民说话的时候不怎么自然，我想他可能带着很重的外乡口音。

String.Source: Like the salmon they fish, the bandits of Orphan's Tear head straight toward their death, simply out of instinct.
String.Dest: 孤儿之泪上的强盗们本能地冲向了死亡，就像他们捕捞的鲑鱼一样。

String.Source: These necromancers were blinded by power. Potema cannot be controlled, as her mind is chaos, and chaos is a wildfire that burns without direction.
String.Dest: 那些亡灵巫师被力量蒙蔽了。波特玛是不会被控制的，她的思想混沌，混沌如同野火般燃烧而没有方向。

String.Source: It seems Meridia has chosen a worthy champion for her blade. Use it well, and use it wisely.
String.Dest: 看起来美瑞蒂亚为自己的剑选择了一个优秀的守护者。好好使用，还有明智的使用。

String.Source: The Rueful Axe. Most fathers would be insulted with such a gift. Did the wizard keep it out of fear, greed, or for its intended purpose?
String.Dest: 悔恨之斧。多数父辈都会以带着这东西为辱。这个巫师是出自恐惧，贪婪，还是为了自己的目的而留着这东西？

String.Source: Meridia's light is dim without the beacon. We must restore it, so that all will know there are Daedra who espouse the pure.
String.Dest: 美瑞蒂亚之光没了灯塔，暗淡无比。我们必须恢复它，这样所以人都会知道，魔族还有着纯粹的拥护者。

String.Source: When a pack outgrows its food source, the cubs will starve, and the pack will die. Peryite blesses them with disease to balance their numbers.
String.Dest: 当一个族群繁殖的量超过了它的食物来源，幼仔就会饿死，族群就会消灭。魄伊特用瘟疫赐予它们数量均衡的祝福

String.Source: It would seem that Barbas is Vile's better half, but one can never be certain with Daedra. Chaos by nature means there is no clear choice.
String.Dest: 看起来巴巴斯是邪恶的另一半儿，但没人能肯定它跟魔族有关。混沌本身就意味着没有明确的选择。

String.Source: Perhaps the Wood Elf here assumed he could tame these wild beasts and make them the guardians of his treasure. But even with magic, wild is wild.
String.Dest: 大概这儿的木精灵假定他能驯服这些野兽作为他财富的守卫。但即使是用魔法，野生的就是野生的。

String.Source: An Elder Scroll! Incredible! The very nature of duality flows through it, and it will balance our strength against Alduin's.
String.Dest: 上古卷轴！难以置信啊！那里面流淌着二元真理之源，可以使我们的力量与奥杜因平衡。

String.Source: The music of the Crimson Nirnroot that grows here is both haunting and soothing. It mirrors the very ambiance of this cavern.
String.Dest: 生长在这红色奈恩根的音乐如此地舒缓又如此地让人难以忘怀，它完全反映出了这个洞穴里的气氛。.

String.Source: Ah, so you have spoken to Clavicus Vile. His wishes are said to be cursed, yet perhaps it is the wisher who knows not what he desires.
String.Dest: 这么说你和克拉维斯麦尔交谈过了。据说他的希望是被诅咒的，或许不去弄清他的欲望的人才是更机智的。

String.Source: These people serve the Falmer. Like their masters before them, they have thrown away their rights as mortals.
String.Dest: 这些人为雪精灵服务。如同他们的主人以前的所作所为一样，他们也舍弃了自己作为凡人的权利。

String.Source: Alchemy and enchanting tables, fireplaces and dining chairs, and they all face away from the door. Your back is turned from danger, as is your mind.
String.Dest: 炼金室和附魔台，火炉和就餐椅，所有这些都背对着门。你的后背毫无防备，如同的你的心一样。

String.Source: There are times when wisdom and madness are two sides of the same coin. If this man were a coin, it would have two tails.
String.Dest: 俗话说天才与疯子就像硬币的正反面。如果这个人是枚硬币的话，那他应该有两个反面。

String.Source: An ancient ruin frozen solid. Thus this once great temple is preserved, even as it is destroyed.
String.Dest: 一名祖先毁掉了冰冻立方体。因此即使是被毁掉了，但这一伟大的寺庙依然保存了下来。

String.Source: The problem with the Greybeards and the Blades is their adherence to absolutes. It makes things difficult when they need each other's counsel.
String.Dest: 灰胡子和刀锋会之间的问题是他们各自秉持自己的思想。于是在他们需要彼此的建议时，这让一切变得阻难重重。

String.Source: And so we ascend the mountain once more, for the world demands a savior, just as it demands to be consumed.
String.Dest: 所以我们再次登上了那座山。因为世界需要一个救世主，正如世界需要被毁灭。

String.Source: The Gildergreen. It is the very symbol of Whiterun. It reminds me of a parable, if you wish to hear it.
String.Dest: 翠苒树。这是雪漫城的象征。这让我想起了一则寓言故事，你想听吗。

String.Source: While the level of education is different, all schools follow the same formula of training. I am recalling a story. Would you like to hear it?
String.Dest: 虽然教育等级不同，但所有的学校都遵循一个训练公式。我正在回述一个故事。你要来听听么？

String.Source: The Vigilants do not know that their enthusiasm will only result in their ruin. It reminds me of a parable. Would you like to hear it?
String.Dest: 警戒者不知道他们的热忱只会导致灭亡。这让我想起一个比喻。你想听吗？

String.Source: We must be careful when entering an old ruin. Time changes owners, and this Akaviri Temple may be Haven to something far more sinister than the sky.
String.Dest: 进入古代废墟的时候我们一定要小心。时间会改变所有权，这虽然是阿卡维尔的神殿可也会被某种比天神更危险的东西占据的。

String.Source: In a time like this, one must take only what is needed. One must not let temptation distort this fact.
String.Dest: 在这样的时代，一个人必须要做必要的事儿。而且还不能让诱惑歪曲了事实。

String.Source: Brilliance and insanity are partners in the same dance. When speaking with Esbern, we can only wonder which of the two will lead.
String.Dest: 才华和疯狂是同一支舞里的合作伙伴.当我与伊思本说话的时候，我们只是想知道它们两个哪个在领舞。

String.Source: While ostensibly you work alone, there will be many guests at the Embassy from all parts of Skyrim. Perhaps you will find another ally among them.
String.Dest: 你在大使馆里独自行动的时候，大使馆里会有来自天际省各处的人。或许你能在他们中间找到盟友。

String.Source: You escaped the Embassy...walked right into the belly of the whale, and came out clean on the other side. Hmm...perhaps that is not the best analogy.
String.Dest: 你逃离了大使馆...就像钻进一头鲸鱼的肚子却毫发无伤地从另一端钻了出来似的。嗯...这个比喻可能并不贴切。

String.Source: The Horn is in Riverwood then. Despite all the trials that required the Whirlwind Sprint, it seems we are still one step behind.
String.Dest: 号角在河木镇。尽管所有的测试都需要旋风冲刺，但看样子我们还是落后一步

String.Source: It appears the dragons are multiplying, but so are those who seek to vanquish them. Now with Delphine, you have another ally.
String.Dest: 看来龙的数量一直在增加，但仍有些人试图要打败它们。现在再加上戴尔菲娜，你有另一个盟友了。

String.Source: Dried fish, salted meats...Klimmek's food reminds me of my days as a monk.
String.Dest: 鱼干，腌肉……科林麦的食物让我想起自己当修士的日子。

String.Source: As the conjurers and the Draugr fight each other, it seems our path is made easier, but the survivor of this arena will be a formidable foe.
String.Dest: 尸鬼和法师在对着干呢，这样看来我们可以坐收渔翁之利了，不过在这个竞技场中获胜的人将会成为我们可怕的对手。

String.Source: Ivarstead. To reach the Greybeards, we must climb the 7,000 steps. An overwhelming number to be sure, but all journeys begin and end with one.
String.Dest: 在紫杉镇，为了到达灰胡子那里,我们必须得爬7000级台阶。台阶的数量当然很多。但所有旅途的开始和结束都和这7000级台阶息息相关。

String.Source: It is odd that Greybeards are in favor of letting you skip the mental training. For that is what gives you the discipline to control your power.
String.Dest: 灰胡子居然赞同让你跳过精神训练，很奇怪。精神训练毕竟能让你获得控制自己力量的能力。

String.Source: One wonders just how far the Thieves Guild has fallen, if two vagrants were planning to undermine it.
String.Dest: 如果这两个流浪者计划去暗中破坏的话，盗贼工会的一个奇迹会掉多远呢？

String.Source: The first test for any new member is more than a test of aptitude. These thieves wish to test your ability to do the unsavory. To face your victim.
String.Dest: 第一个测试对任何新成员而言，不仅仅是对能力的考验。这些小偷想测试你在面对你的受害者时，做坏事的能力。

String.Source: It is natural for the owner of Goldenglow Estate to rebel, given Maven's actions and how weak the Guild is. He could not have foreseen your arrival.
String.Dest: 对金辉庄园的拥有者来说，产生反抗的念头是很自然的。鉴于玛雯的行动和公会是多么脆弱。他只是没有预见你的到来。

String.Source: The balance of any potion, whether it is mead or medicine, is very delicate. The poison will alter the composition just enough to avoid suspicion.
String.Dest: 不管是蜜酒还是药物，饮料的配制都是非常细致的。药剂会一直调配直到无可挑剔为止。

String.Source: Mercer insists this mystery backer slipped up, but looking at the bill of sale, there was no need to mention the agent by name, even by an alias.
String.Dest: 墨瑟强调神秘赞助者遛了，但看这销售的账单，根本没必要提到代理的名字或别名。

String.Source: Mercer insists this mystery backer slipped up, but looking at the bill of sale, there was no need to mention the agent by name, even by an alias.
String.Dest: 墨瑟强调神秘赞助者遛了，但看这销售的账单，根本没必要提到代理的名字或别名。

String.Source: They say that the world of business is very cutthroat. One wonders if Maven Black-Briar takes this term literally.
String.Dest: 他们都说商场如战场，感觉这已经被玛雯·黑荆棘奉为准则。

String.Source: Every action has a consequence. When the Arch-Mage casts a madman out, he may quarantine his school, but he poisons the world.
String.Dest: 凡事有因必有果。当一个首席法师把一个疯子释放出来，他也许把他的学院隔离开了，但还是对这个世界产生了些不好的影响。

String.Source: At last, our broker has a name. Karliah. Perhaps Mercer will be able to fill in the rest.
String.Dest: 最后，我们的经纪人有一个名字。卡莱雅。也许墨瑟会填补剩下的。

String.Source: It appears your fate is now tied to Karliah's. To prove her innocence is to prove your own.
String.Dest: 这表明你的命运已经和卡莱雅连在了一起. 证明她的清白便是证明了你的清白.

String.Source: How does one pick an unbreakable lock? To know the solution, one simply must ask, how does any miracle happen? The answer is quite clear.
String.Dest: 如何选择一个牢不可破的锁？这个答案等同于，如何才能使奇迹发生呢？答案是十分明确的。

String.Source: It seems Mercer has been plotting for some time, but Karliah's presence has hastened his plans. Let us hope his haste causes him to falter.
String.Dest: 看情况墨瑟那家伙密谋很久了。但卡莉亚的出现让他不得不把计划提前。让我们祈祷他因为仓促行动而导致计划失败吧。

String.Source: Mercer has quite the audacity if he defiles Nocturnal's temple. A mortal with a God complex is his own worst enemy.
String.Dest: 如果墨瑟亵渎了诺克图娜尔的神庙，那这家伙就太放肆了。一个把自己当做神的凡人是他自己最可怕的敌人。

String.Source: Ah, the three of you are safe. The cave collapsed, and I feared it did not bode well for your escape.
String.Dest: 啊，你们仨都安全了。看见那洞塌了，我还担心恐怕你们出不来了。

String.Source: In a short time, the callow thief has become the guildmaster. Yet if one only looks only at the calendar, he ignores the depth of experiences within.
String.Dest: 在短短的时间里,那年轻的盗贼已经成为了会长。但如果一个人仅从日历的数字来看的话，那么这人会忽略掉期间所经历过的事物的深度。

String.Source: You have 3 choices regarding the skeleton key. You can return it, keep it, or wait until it has exhausted its use. Nocturnal awaits your decision.
String.Dest: 关于骷髅钥匙，你有三个选择。你可以归还它，继续保留它，或是等待到它再也不能用。诺克图娜尔等待你的决定。

String.Source: So you aim to join the Thieves Guild. Many are quick to disparage the role of the thief, but do not include the locksmith or the guard among them.
String.Dest: 所以你的目标是加入盗贼工会。大多数人都草率的贬低着盗贼的作用，除了锁匠和警卫。

String.Source: You are now the Harbinger. You are the leader, and yet no Companion answers to anyone. It is a system that mimics the very world we live in.
String.Dest: 你现在是先驱了。你是领头人，但没有一个战友把这件事告诉任何人。这套体系正是效仿了我们所生活的世界。

String.Source: Kodlak has made many choices, but his fate will be decided by his choice of Companions. Let us see where they stack up against the original ones.
String.Dest: 克拉科做过许多选择，但他的命运在他决定加入战友团的那一刻就确定了。让我们看看这一次次积累起来的选择会如何挑战传统。

String.Source: The timing of Kodlak's death is tragic, and curious. One wonders if Hircine set the Silver Hand in motion, so that he could claim his vassal.
String.Dest: 克拉科死亡的时机悲惨且稀奇.有人好奇海尔辛是否会兴奋地设置银手，这样他就能索取他的奴仆。

String.Source: This rogue mage Stalleo speaks of is nowhere to be found, but the evidence is overwhelming. Whoever lived here was no ordinary enchanter.
String.Dest: 这个流氓魔法师斯塔莱奥而且他一事无成，但是证据是压倒性的。在这住着的人没有一般的巫师。

String.Source: Kodlak insists his predecessor was tricked, but I am not sure. One does not make a contract with witches that is so one-sided.
String.Dest: 克拉科坚持认为他的祖先被骗了，但我不敢苟同。那个人也没跟女巫们签个合同，这太片面了。

String.Source: The man has reclaimed his castle, yet his life is in shambles. The rogue mage has won, even when he has lost.
String.Dest: 男人夺回了他的城堡，而他的生命摇摇欲坠。那流氓的法师成功了，即使他刚刚被击败。

String.Source: Follow me. I need your help.
String.Dest: 跟着我。我需要你的帮助。

String.Source: Then let us wander these white sands, and find our destination.
String.Dest: 然后让我们漫步于这白色的沙滩，并找到我们的目的地吧。.

String.Source: May your road lead you to warm sands.
String.Dest: 愿你的前路是温暖的沙地。

String.Source: Moons guide us.
String.Dest: 月亮引领着我们。

String.Source: A long conversation is a feast of wisdom. Remember to savor every bite.
String.Dest: 一次深长的谈话时一场智慧盛宴。要记得细细品味。

String.Source: The timing of Kodlak's death is tragic, and curious. One wonders if Hircine set the Silver Hand in motion, so that he could claim his vassal.
String.Dest: 克拉科死亡的时机悲惨且稀奇.有人好奇海尔辛是否会兴奋地设置银手，这样他就能索取他的奴仆。

String.Source: How about a drink? The night is still young, and even a monk desires a spirit every now and then.
String.Dest: 来几杯如何？夜还未深，就连修士时不时都会想喝点酒。

String.Source: One should never speed up to catch up with life. One should slow life down to walk at your pace.
String.Dest: 人们绝不应该加快脚步急急度过人生。人们应该放慢人生追随在您的脚步之下

String.Source: Ah, we have stopped. I patiently await your counsel.
String.Dest: 啊，我们停下了。我会耐心等待你的计划的。

String.Source: Well met.
String.Dest: 幸会。

String.Source: Ah, you return.
String.Dest: 啊,你回来了。

String.Source: Greetings, traveler.
String.Dest: 你好，旅行者。

String.Source: May our steps move in harmony.
String.Dest: 愿我们的步伐处于平衡之中。

String.Source: Be careful!
String.Dest: 小心！

String.Source: I am on your side!
String.Dest: 我就在你身边！

String.Source: Stop that!
String.Dest: 停下来！
